Lo que más le complace D. su negocio; es que no queda comida, además ver sus ganancias acumularse le da mucha satisfacción. En adelante piensa ampliar su negocio, vendiendo picarones por las tardes, para que pueda captar mayores ingresos, que le ayudaran a cubrir la educación D. sus hijos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como antes. Francisca tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita, en la compra D. ollas, vasijas D. diversos tamaños e insumos para la preparación D. sus potajes.
texts.en:
48-year old Francisca is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and three children in their own house. She sells food from a stall located five blocks away from her neighbourhood. Every day she prepares different dishes such as fried fish, chanfainita (a local meat dish), chicken with rice, ocopa sauce (a Peruvian specialty maD. from chilis and peanuts), and other local soups which are requested by her customers. She makes the casseroles in her home, but the fish is fried at her stall located in the busiest market in the area. Francisca’s customers visit her stall between 10am and 1pm, and she always serves them in a friendly manner. The parts of her business that most please her is when there is no food left over, and when she can see the profits start accumulating. In the future she plans to expand the business by selling picarones (a kind of doughnut) in the afternoons so that she can earn more money to pay for her children’s education. This is Francisca’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to pay back the money according to the schedule, as she has done before. She plans to use the loan to buy saucepans, different sized pots, and ingredients for her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy saucepans, pots, and ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Materials to progress the business

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en:
Ulziijargal G. is a 33-year-old single man who lives with his mother in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His mother is unemployed and helps him with his business.

Ulziijargal operates two different businesses and both are seasonal. In winter months, he operates a raw material trade while in summer months, he sells a variety of fruits in the local community. He has been operating those two businesses since 2008, and has built a stable operation.

Ulziijargal buys a large amount of bilberries and blueberries from Tosontsengel, one of the communes of Zavhan, and sells them at a stall in the market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Ulziijargal is a very hardworking man; using his earnings, he has managed to create for himself a demand deposit at the bank of 1,500,000 MNT.

Ulziijargal is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase 200kg of fruits to resell in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase 200kg of fruits to resell in Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Melie

texts.en:
Melie D. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Melie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melie raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, she also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes for her business to grow.

Melie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Melie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase farm supplies and feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en: Jabbar B. has been engaged in farming and cultivating seasonal fruits and vegetables for three years. The father of two adorable daughters who need to be fed and provided with the necessary education, Jabbar is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to improve his business which, in turn, will benefit his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren D. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest son is a university student, and his daughter attends a college while his youngest son attends a local elementary school. His wife works in the food factory. Lhagvasuren used to work in the food factory from 1992 to 1995. Since 1992, he has also been herding people's livestock. Lhagvasuren is a modest, honest man and says, " I hope to provide a good education for my three children." He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to pay for his eldest son's tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay his oldest son's tuition fee

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Lydia has a poultry business, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase maize bran.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.

In the future, Lydia hopes to own a plot of land. Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To buy maize bran for chicken feed

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer L. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Jenifer is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jenifer owns and operates a handicraft business.  The main source of income of the business comes from selling paper bags in the local community. Jenifer has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jenifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will provide additional capital for her business. This will be Jenifer's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for her business

loans.name: Las Audaces Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “LAS AUDACES” ellas le pusieron a su grupo así porque dicen que son valientes, que no tiene miedo D. hacer cosas nuevas e innovadoras. Este grupo está ubicado en el municipio D. Zitacuaro en el Estado D. Michoacán. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. 

L. representante del grupo se llama Leticia Colín Sanabria, elL. tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada con el señor Patricio quien es profesor D. una escueL. primaria, ellos tienen 4 hijos, pero vive nada mas con ellos su hija que es madre soltera y su nieto llamado Santiago D. 4 años el cual doña Leti se hizo cargo D. él desD. que nació ya que su hija estaba estudiando y en estos momentos trabaja como contadora. Doña Leti está pidiendo su préstamo para invertir en su negocio D. joyería fina (oro) elL. se surte en L. cuidad D. Morolion Guanajuato ya que en esa ciudad le dan buenos precios ya que es clienta desD. hace 12 años y a los cuales elL. les pueD. subir un poco y no dar tan cara su joyería . ElL. comenta que le está echando muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que quiere que su hijo que estudiando leyes pueda terminar su carrera y pueda comprarle los libros que el ocupa. Ahorita uno D. sus propósitos es aclientarse y vender a gente que no le queD. mal en sus pagos, más que nada personas que tengan un trabajo estable, y uno D. sus sueños es rentar un local y establecerse ya que es muy peligroso traer joyas finas en L. calle, también uno D. sus sueños es poder remodelar su casa ya que en tiempo D. lluvia se le trasmina el agua. 

Elvia B. López, también es parte del grupo “LAS AUDACES” tiene 43 años y estudio hasta el segundo año D. secundaria comenta que no terminó sus estudios ya que sus papás no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirL. apoyando con los gastos D. L. escueL.. Doña Elvia está casada con el señor Lemuel él se dedica a vender animales como borregos y vacas, ellos tienen 6 hijos pero nada más uno vive con ellos llamado Ricardo el cual trabaja con su papá y ayuda a vender los animales. ElL. se dedica a vender productos D. belleza por catálogo como cremas, cosméticos etc. También venD. lencería para dama por catalogo, lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 6 años, decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar con su esposo con los gastos D. sus hijos ya que hubo un tiempo que todos estaban estudiando y tenían que pagar colegiaturas y rentas en otras ciudades donD. estudiaban ellos. Doña Elvia está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en lencería y cosméticos para tener en existencia y no pedirlos por que es algo tardado los pedidos que realiza. 

Las otras 10 integrantes se llaman Ma. Guadalupe Jiménez Rojas, Irma M. Andrés, Ma. Maribel Vázquez Araujo, Yolanda M. Vilchis, Avelina L. Morales, Amalia D. L. C. Colector, Jhovanna Elizabeth Guzmán Flores, Verónica Velázquez Araujo y Viridiana M. Lorenzo, ellas quieren los préstamos para invertir en venta D. zapatos por catalogo, medicina natural por Catalogo, venta D. ropa, café internet y club nutricional etc.
texts.en:
This group is called “LAS AUDACES” (The Bold Ones).   They chose this name because they say they are brave, that they don’t fear doing new and innovative things.  The group is located in the municipality of Zitácuaro, Michoacán.  It has 12 members.

The group representative’s name is Leticia Colín Sanabria.  She is 46 years old, married to Patricio, who is an elementary school teacher. They have four children but only one of their daughters, who’s a single mother and their grandson, Santiago, 4, who Leticia has cared for since birth because her daughter was still in school and is now working as an Accountant, lives with them.

Leti is asking for her loan to invest in her fine jewelry (gold) business.  She stocks up in the city of Moroleón, Guanajuato, because she gets good prices there because she’s been a customer there for 12 years.  She is then able to raise prices just a little and not be forced to sell her jewelry for prices that are too expensive.  She comments that she is really putting in much effort into her work because she wants her son, who is studying Law, to finish his career and be able to buy him the textbooks he requires.

One of her goals for right now is to acquire customers and sell to people who won’t fall back on their payments, above all to people who have stable employment.  One of her dreams is to rent a locale that she can set up shop in because it’s quite dangerous to be carrying fine jewelry in the street. Another one of her dreams is to be able to repair her house because in the rainy season there are leaks.

Elvia B. López is also part of the “LAS AUDACES” group.  She is 43 years old and finished 8th graD..  She comments that she was unable to finish her education because her parents didn’t have enough money to continue paying her school costs.  Elvia is married to Lemuel who sells animals like sheep and cows.  They have 6 children but only one of them, named Ricardo who works with his father and helps sell the animals, lives with them.

She sells catalogue beauty products like creams, cosmetics, etc.  She also sells women’s lingerie by catalogue.  She has been in this business for about 6 years.  She decided to go into it to help her husband meet their children’s expenses because there was a time when they were all in school and they had to pay tuition and rent in other cities where they were studying.  Elvia is asking for her loan to invest in lingerie and cosmetics to have stock on hand and not have to place orders because this is time consuming.

The other 10 members are: Ma. Guadalupe Jiménez Rojas, Irma M. Andrés, Ma. Maribel Vázquez Araujo, Yolanda M. Vilchis, Avelina L. Morales, Amalia D. L. C. Colector, Jhovanna Elizabeth Guzmán Flores, Verónica Velázquez Araujo and Viridiana M. Lorenzo.  They want the loan to invest in catalogue shoe sales, catalogue natural medicine sales, clothing sales, Internet café, nutritional club, etc.

loans.use: To buy fine jewelry.

loans.name: Carmen Victoria

texts.es:
Carmen Victoria G. C. tiene 57 años. Es viuda, vive con los hijos que son solteros, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 11 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando y que crezca la producción.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del niño dios en septiembre y diciembre con la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Victoria G. C. is 57. She is a widow and lives with her unmarried children. She lives in the San Miguel canton in the province of Bolivar. She has 11 children. The members of the V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA live 30 minutes from the San Miguel Office, belonging to the San Miguel canton. This sector is devoted to agriculture as a source of household income. Here they sow corn and small quantities of potatoes and beans. Carmen works in agriculture and sows corn and potatoes. She purchases her products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel, and sells them in the San miguel market on Thursdays.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural items. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her necessities. They face challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy land to continue sowing, and for her production to increase. She likes to celebrate the holidays of the Niño Dios in September and December with her family.

loans.use: agricultural items

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang B. is strongly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He wife sells gasoline in the local market, Kompong Chhnang province. Tang B. has two children, all of whom are students and dependent on him. Currently, his wife's business is the profitable one in the family, and now she wants to invest more capital to buy more gasoline to stock. She will sell it when the price increases. That is why Tang B. has decided to ask for a loan from lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline for future sales while the price is low

loans.name: Zadi

texts.es: Zadi, de 40 años, tiene dos hijos que viven con su padre. puesto que es separa y actualmente convive con otra persona.  Durante los dos años de su nueva relación, Zadi se dedica en vender galletas y gaseosa en el cafetín del colegio que se encuentra cerca de su casa. Hoy los alumnos están de vacaciones, es por ello que se dedica en confeccionar polos y prendas deportivas en cantidad, para cuando se inicien las clases poder venderlo, ya que son prendas que necesariamente los alumnos deben comprar. Por ahora este trabajo lo esta desarrollando en el taller  de su amiga; con ello espera aumentar sus ganancias e invertir en el cafetín. A ella le gusta afrontar nuevos retos, por ello piensa a futuro instalar una guardería en casa de su madre, espera poco a poco mejorar su calidad de vida. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, y no quiere dejar de pagar sus cuotas, por ello ve la forma de generarse mayores ingresos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas en numerosas cantidades para confeccionar más polos y buzos, para cuando se reinicie las clases.
texts.en: Zadi is 40 years old and she has 2 children and they live with their father. She is separated and she lives with another person. During the two years with her new relationship, Zadi sold cookies and soft drinks from a canteen in a school near her house. Currently students are on holidays and so she makes polo shirts and active wear in bulk, so that when classes resume she will be able to make her sales.  These items of clothing are required to be purchased by students. For now she has used her friend's sewing shop. She will be able to increase her earnings and invest in her canteen.  She likes to set new goals so in the future she wants to set up a day care in her mother's house, with the hopes of improving her life. This is her ninth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she won't let her payments go unpaid, which is why she is always looking for better earnings. The loan she requests will be used to purchase large quantities of fabrics to make more polo shirts and jackets for when classes start.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Oem N. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and one of his children in Battambang province. He and his wife have been recyclers since 2000 and are able to make a profit of about US $7 every day. Oem N. is asking for a loan of US $800 to reinvest in his recycling business.

loans.use: to reinvest in his recycling business

loans.name: Luisa Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Luisa C. es socia del banco comunal Tres de Noviembre, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre que  pertenece a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo y porvenir de sus familias.

La Señora. Luisa tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, esta muy emocionada ya que se encuentra embarazada de 6 meses, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar, su esposo labora en el duro trabajo de minero.

Doña Luisa labora como empleada privada, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años, de domingo a domingo en turnos rotativos.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luisa C. is a member of the Tres de Noviembre community bank.  She lives in the community of the same name which is located in Cumbe parish.  This is a cold climate parish which has beautiful landscapes.  The locals work in commerce, farming and livestock raising.  Many have migrated in search of better jobs and a better future for their families.

Luisa is 26 years old.  She lives with her partner and has a 3 year-old child.  She is very excited because she is 6 months pregnant.  She doesn't own her own home and lives with her mom.  They share the household expenses.  Luisa's husband has a hard job, working as a miner.

Luisa works as a private employee.  She has been in her job for 2 years and works from Sunday to Sunday, working daily shifts.

This is Luisa's third loan through her community bank and she will invest her money in buying livestock to start out in this business.  Her goal is to one day own her own home.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Forward Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Forward” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Gbassay F.. Gbassay was born in the northern city of Makeni 33 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a motor-bike taxi driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Gbassay has been selling cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and rice for 5 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothes and rice in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is from the village of Labo, Aloran, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is a 35-year-old widow with four very young children and one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Ann runs a business venture in the services sector specializing in auto repair in the local community.

Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for more than 1 year and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase spare parts for her auto repair business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for an auto repair business

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat T., 52, is a farmer in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has income of about 1.80 USD per day. Her husband, Kim Von, is 46. His job is buying cows for resale, earning an income of about 3.33 USD per day. They have 3 children who work in factories. Each month, the family has to spend 61 USD on food, 2 USD on utilities and 20 USD on the other necessary expenses. Vat T. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase cows for resale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long- standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is from Besease Village, near the fishing town of Elmina. 

She prepares and sells salted fish to make a living, something she has done for the past 10 years. 

Efua is now keen to expand her business and needs a loan to purchase more fish as well as sauce pans. She hopes that this will lead to increased sales and profits. She intends to reinvest the profits back into her business to grow it further. 

Efua is married and has five children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish as well as sauce pans.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.en: Muazzam is married and has five children, all of them grown up. She is from Khujand, Tajikistan, where she runs her own business selling groceries in a store next to her house. One of the advantages of her small venture is the lack of competition in the neighborhood. Muazzam has a degree in commerce and has been working in the sphere of food manufacture and sale for about 12 years. She is also very energetic and motivated. She always moves forward actively to reach new goals and make her business more lucrative. Muazzam is very creative and knows how to financially manage her enterprise. Currently, she is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to purchase food items from wholesalers to then sell in her store. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Xalafal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement XALAFAL a été créé le 08 mai 2010.Il est composé de 22 femmes issues du meme village.Elles ont pour principale activé le petit commerce du sucre.

Madame Wanegué à droite, en position debout;le bras levé est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 59 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et s'occupe également de 05 autres enfants dont elle a la garde.

Elle a pour activité le petit commerce du sucre et de l'huile;elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquer pendant 02 ans.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter du bétail pour faire de l'élevage,et aussi acheter du sucre et de l'huile en vue de les revendre.

Son objectif est d'aider son mari en l'appuyant dans les charges du ménage: scolarité des enfants;la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
texts.en:
The Darou Fall group was created on May 8, 2010. It is composed of 22 women who come from the same village. Their main activity is buying and selling sugar. 

Madame Wanegué, on the right, standing with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is 59, married, and the mother of three children. She also cares for five other children for whom she is responsible.  

Her main activity is buying and selling sugar and oil. She has good experience since she has been in this business for two years. 

Her loan will allow her to buy livestock to raise, as well as buying sugar and oil for resale. Her goal is to help her husband cover family expenses such as the children's school fees and daily household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy livestock, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, girders, bolts and welding materials to put a roof on her house so that she can move into it soon

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella vende chupetes, caramelos, chicles entre otras golosinas, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, caramelos y chicles. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

She is 64 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling sweets. She sells suckers, caramels, gum and other sweets. She works from 6am until 8pm. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her sweets business. She requests a loan to purchase sweets such as suckers, caramels, and gum.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase sweets such as suckers, caramels, and gum.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 41-year-old married man with five children living in a residential permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His family dream is to buy a plot in a town so that he can build and expand his foods store.

Eric has been a farmer for 10 years, and the sector has been beneficial since it has facilitated him in paying school fees for his children. His main challenge is the high cost of transporting his agricultural products and a lack of modern equipment to handle fresh products; nonetheless, he dreams of becoming the leading supplier of fresh foods in the region.

Eric needs the loan to clear land for next season's planting.

loans.use: To clear for next season's planting.

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn is a 30-year-old married woman. At this young age, she already has five children to attend to. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Three years ago, she began doing this service-based activity. Total earnings of PHP 2,000 are generated per month. It is definitely a meager amount to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Wendelyn applied for a loan in GDMPC worth PHP 10,000. The money will be used to purchase motor accessories for a good quality service. Wendelyn hopes to improve the business and earn more.

loans.use: To purchase motor accessories for good  quality service.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia de 35 años convive con José, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.Está emprendedora mujer, hace tan solo 5 años, que comenzó con la actividad de siembra de maca, su producto bandera. Siembra este producto en terrenos de la comunidad, que son alejados, hermosos y espacioso. Primero, vendía su producción a los intermediarios que trasladaban sus cosechas a la ciudad de Junín. Luego, al ver que la maca que producía y era de buena calidad, Eulalia, recibió la propuesta de vender su producción a una empresa procesadora de bebidas a base de maca en la capital. Desde entonces comenzó a invertir en la mejora de la calidad de su producto, el cual le genera ganancias netas entre 9 mil a 10 mil nuevos soles anuales. Por ello está planeando abrir su propia empresa de procesadora de maca, con la cual pueda expandir su negocio y por ende generar mejores ganancias, en corto plazo.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de San Pedro” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde está segura de salir adelante junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal y agradece el apoyo recibido de parte de todos ustedes. Eulalia este año recibió un incremento en las ventas de Maca, aún le falta por extraer y es por eso que de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en la cosecha de Maca.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 35 years old and in a common-law marriage with her husband José. They have four young children and live in their own home in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. She is an enterprising woman who started growing “maca” five years ago since it is a prized crop. The land on which she plants is in a remote part of her community that is beautiful and spacious. At first Eulalia sold her crop to brokers who transported her product to the city of Junín. After she determined that the “maca” she produced was of good quality, Eulalia received an offer to sell her harvest to a beverage processing company in Lima that uses this product. Since then, she began investing in her crop in order to improve its quality. Eulalia earns a yearly net income between 9000 to 10,000 PEN. For this reason, she plans to open her own “maca” processing company so that she can expand her business and generate more earnings in the short term.

Eulalia is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de San Pedro” (Heart of San Pedero) and this will be her third loan with MFP. She is confident of achieving success along with the other members of her Communal Bank. Eulalia appreciates the support that she has received from everyone. She increased her “maca” sales orders this year, but her crop has yet to be harvested. This is why she is requesting assistance. Eulalia will invest the money she requested in the hiring of workers to help harvest the “maca”.

loans.use: to hire workers to help with harvesting.

loans.name: Solidario Peniel Group

texts.es:
DUO PENIEL
Este grupo está formado por Liliana Patricia, de 20 años de edad, es soltera, y se dedica a  la venta de blusas y flores en la terminal de Guatemala,ella es la lider de este grupo y cuenta con su negocio desde hace 5 años, y nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder comprar más blusas ya que necesita surtir su negocio,y tener mas bariedad de estilo en ropa también esta doña Ana Veróninca, de 30 años, casada tiene 5 hijos y nos cuenta que tiene un negocio de venta de blusas y ropa interior, desde hace 8 años, también vende suéteres, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder surtir su venta ya que hay nuevos estilos de blusas y las señoritas buscan esos estilos moderno y diferentes colores y las blusas de tela fina están muy caras por lo tanto necesita este crédito para invertir y así tener más venta y poder satisfacer a toda su clientela que siempre busca comprarle, confía en que fape pueda brindarle esta oportunidad y confía en Dios que la bendecirá, para poder ser buena socia de fape.

loans.use: Compra de Ropa en diferentes estilos para dama

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: Maria Salome: D. 32 años D. edad ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales como pollos chompipes,cerdos,etc ella nos cuenta que desD. hace varios años ella se dedica a esta actividad ya que  es un medio D. ingresos para su familia,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales para crianza ya que el sueño D. ella es agrandar mas su negocio y obtemer mejores ingresos,para ayudar a su familia,
texts.en: Maria Salome is 32 years old.  Her business is raising animals such as chickens, turkeys, pigs, etc.  She tells us that she has been in this business for several years and it is a source of income for her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals to raise as her dream is to further expand her business and make more income, so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene tres hijos ya  todos mayores de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga se dedica junto a su esposo a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas,  tamarindo cocinado por libras, maní en grano y molido, achiote y otros productos más al por mayor y menor. Trabajan todos los días de 4 h00 hasta las 15h00, nos cuenta que ellos además de vender por la zona en la que viven también se desplazan a otras ciudades como Manta, Portoviejo y Quevedo, lugares donde venden a muy buen precio sus productos. Los productos para la venta los compran a los agricultores de la zona, luego ella los procesa y después los llevan a entregar.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar maní, tamarindo y achiote para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por los beneficios que reciben del banco.
 
Su meta es comprarce un carro para realizar sus ventas con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Amor y Paz” (Love and Peace) meets every 15 days in the parish of Calderón in the city of Portoviejo. Most of the people who live in this area engage in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Sra. Ana lives in this place. She is 47 years old, married, and has three grown children. Her husband is a merchant.

Ana and her husband buy and sell agricultural products such as cooked tamarind by the pound, whole and ground peanuts, annatto, and many other products in bulk and in smaller amounts. They work every day from 4am to 3pm. Ana says that they sell in the area where they live, but they also travel to other cities such as Manta, Portoviejo, and Quevedo where they can sell their products at a very good price. Ana and her husband buy their products from local farmers and she is in charge of processing them before they are sold.

This loan will be used to buy peanuts, tamarind, and annatto for eventual resale. Ana has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and she enjoys the benefits that she has received. Her goal is to buy car so that she can make her sales much more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, tamarind, and annatto.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly (pictured here), 31, and her husband, Sopheak, 31, live in a suburb approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young son.

Somaly stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He sells cosmetic and perfume and sprays. He buys them from Phnom Penh market and carries them in his own van to sell in other provinces away from his house. 

Somaly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to buy additional cosmetics perfume and sprays to sell.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband to buy additional cosmetics perfume and sprays to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married and blessed with three children. For the last twenty years, she has been managing a grocery to make a living. She has employed one person to help her to run the business. Hellen has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.  With 50,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy fruits for resale.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 47 years old and married.   She has nine children between the ages of 4 and 27. Belinda's husband works as a farmer and a Barangay official.

Belinda is also a farmer. She works with her husband tilling their land and growing rice crops. Belinda has been engaged in rice farming for ten years. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Belinda hopes to have a stable income that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a single mother of three children; two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and meat for roasting. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and meat for roasting.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married with 2 children. Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 28,000  through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. Alicia has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Alicia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Fofoa

texts.en:
Fofoa, age 67, plants and harvests taro and offers her harvested produce for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Fofoa needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family. She and her husband have raised seven children.
 
In 2010, Fofoa joined SPBD* to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fofoa's second loan with SPBD. 
 
*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Víctor Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Víctor vende juguetes, ropa interior y tajada con queso que se las da a vender a dos trabajadores por lo cual ellos se ganan dos córdobas por cada bolsita de tajada vendida, el negocio lo tiene en la terminal de buses. Ha trabajado diez créditos con ceprodel y estos han sido para compra de mercadería para su negocio. El visita nuevamente las instalaciones de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de juguetes ya que esta es una buena temporada para el.
Es casado vive con su esposa y dos hijos que están en el colegio.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor sells toys, undergarments, and sliced plantains with cheese. He employs two workers and pays them 2 NIO for each bag of sliced plantains that they sell. Victor’s business is located at the bus terminal. He has received 10 loans from CEPRODEL which were used to buy merchandise for his business.

Once again, he visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan so that he can buy toys because this is a good season for him. Victor is married and lives with his wife and their two children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Bada

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bada est cultivateur depuis qu’il est tout jeune .Il  est mariée et père de famille. I l  adore son métier qui lui a été appris par son père .Il a une expérience de  35 ans.
Avec le crédit il veut acheter des semences (choux et des intrants agricoles).
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Monsieur Bada compte aménager d’autres superficies pour augmenter sa capacité de production
texts.en:
Mr. Bada has been a crop farmer from an early age. He is married and a father, and manages his family's daily expenditures.

He loves his profession which he learned from his father, and has an accumulated 35 years of experience.

With the loan he wants to buy seeds (cabbage and agricultural inputs). Mr. Bada intends to clear other areas for farming to increase his production capacity.

loans.use: buy seeds (cabbage and agricultural inputs)

loans.name: Proem's Group

texts.en:
Proem is 28 years old, married, and lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has two dependent children who are still in school. She has been farming rice as her main income source to support her living for more than four years. Sometimes, Proem and her husband work for others to raise extra income to better support their family. 

Now she leads a group of four female members in the village. Her group has been with VisionFund since 2010. She currently earns US $6 per day and is able to afford sufficient food for her family. She is requesting another loan with the other three members. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay for a water pump to carry water to her rice paddy. This loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully, and she hopes it will increase her crop yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for a water pump for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En del cantón 24 De Mayo, Provincia de Manabi se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La señora Mariana es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. Tiene 59 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero  de esa relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes.

Para ganarse el sustento diario después de la muerte de sus esposo ella con todos sus recursos y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos arreglo un local en su casa en la cual puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles, la misma que con el paso de los días  le ha ido mejorando y surtiendo cada día mas con la ayuda de los créditos. Lleva tres años en su negocio y nos cuenta que gracias a el no le falta nada y además se entretiene en su local.  Los fines de semana ella también prepara y vende empanadas, con lo cual se gana algo adicional.

Este crédito es para comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the canton 24 De Mayo, Manabi Province, members of the 'Nuevos Horizontes' communal bank meet. It is a place known for its beautiful scenery and hard-working people who are mostly engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry.
 
59-year-old Mariana is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because the stakes are lower than in other credit institutions, and she appreciates the help they have given with the loans. Her husband died several years ago, but she has 6 children from that relationship who are now older and independent.

In order to make a living following the death of her husband, Mariana used all of her resources and with the help of one of the loans she established a small grocery store in her home. Her business has been improving each day, and with the help of loans she is able to stock her store with more merchandise. Mariana has had her business for three years and she says that thanks to the store she is not missing anything and also enjoys herself at work. On weekends, she prepares and sells empanadas which gives her a little extra income.

This loan will be invested in buying staple goods to stock her store.

Mariana's dreams are to continue to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Canisia

texts.es: La socia Canisia; Continua con su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, gallinas, y los lelva a vender en la feria, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ganados vacunos como dos vacas terneras para incrementar uss ventad y mejorar sus ganacias para poder apoyar a sus hijos en la educacion y en cuanto a la calidad de vida. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de dos ganados vacunos terneros.
texts.en: The communal bank member Canisia continues with her business of buying and selling livestock. She raises guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and chickens, and sells them at the local market fair. Canisia, on this occasion, wishes to buy cattle, specifically 2 calves, to increase her sales and improve her earnings, in order to pay for her childrens' education and improve their quality of life. Her loan will be used to buy the 2 calves.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz Mary es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y gracias a esto ha montado junto con su esposo un negocio el cual le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Luz Mary se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos de 4, 5 y 7 años de edad, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Luz Mary tiene una fabricación de arepas las cuales aprendió a hacer gracias a que su esposo trabajó para una empresa de fabricación de arepas como empleado durante mucho tiempo y decidió independizarse para montar junto con Luz Mary su propia fábrica de arepas. Luz Mary ha tenido la oportunidad de acceder a muchos clientes por la buena calidad de sus productos y el buen servicio que ofrece, y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenos niveles de ventas. Debido a que actualmente tiene más pedidos por parte de sus clientes que los que puede satisfacer, Luz Mary busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una moldeadora de arepas para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio.
Luz Mary espera que de esta manera su negocio aumente las ventas considerablemente, pues podrá atender clientes que antes no tenía la capacidad para atenderlos. Luz Mary sueña con tener una gran fábrica de arepas que sea reconocida en su región y con la cual pueda ofrecer empleo para las demás personas. Además, sueña con ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una educación de calidad y mayores oportunidades económicas.

loans.use: Compra de una moldeadora de arepas para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en: Damascene is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 9 months and 6 years; one of them goes to school. He sells clothes and has been in business for four years. With the loan, he would like to buy trousers and shirts to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy land and buy food for at-home consumption.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts to resell.

loans.name: Mwanaamini

texts.en:
Mwanaamani is a 20-year-old entrepreneur. She is a married mother of one child who lives with her husband in Pangani district in Tanzania. To give back to her community, she is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers two and a half hours per week to teach students life skills in her nearby secondary school. 

Mwanamini requests a Kiva loan to start a business selling fruits near her village. She plans to use her profits to expand her business by adding more products and buying household necessities.

loans.use: to start a business of selling fruits near her village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business.

loans.name: Papaloa

texts.en: Papaloa manages the women’s committee in her village of Manono. She is a highly skilled weaver of fine mats, which are traditional treasures in Samoa.  These mats are important cultural objects used for special occasions like weddings, funerals, and title bestowments. Papaloa's  business specializes in providing these beautiful mats for local customers and to the thousands of tourists who visit Samoa year round. Papaloa requests a capital loan in the amount of $675 to purchase pandanus leaves, dyes, paints, feathers and flax for her fine weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for weaving fine mats like: pandanus leaves, dyes, paints, feathers and flax

loans.name: Julián

texts.en:
Julián is a young entrepreneur. Three years ago, he decided to start his own business selling fish, seafood, steaks, etc. with the help of his family. He started out of necessity to give him the funds to continue his education and to help his family with expenses. The business he started with few resources has grown and now Julián also works with his brothers and sisters.

The desire to move up in the world has motivated Julián to continue growing his business. Currently, he needs a $100 loan to buy supplies and ingredients so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. He plans to repay it within three to six months. Your support can help improve the quality of life of Julián and his family and help him reach his dreams of finishing his studies and being a successful businessman. He is grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Julián es un joven emprendedor, desde hace tres años decidió iniciar su propio negocio donde vende pescado, robalo, besugo, filetes, bagre y cebiche, con ayuda de familiares que se dedican a lo mismo. Empezó por la necesidad de obtener recursos que le permitieran continuar estudiando y para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, el negocio que inició con pocos recursos ahora ha estado creciendo y ahora Julián cuenta también con el apoyo de sus hermanos.

Los deseos de superación han motivado a Julián a continuar creciendo con su negocio, en estos momentos él necesita de un crédito por $100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía que le permita tener surtido su negocio para poder ofrecer buenos productos a sus clientes, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir a la realización del sueño de Julián, de concluir sus estudios y ser un empresario exitoso, él agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy fish, seafood, steaks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
In my business I sell secondhand clothes and tennis shoes, but I would like to invest in buying more things to sell; like this I will be able to have more clients and a bigger income. The location of my business is very good since it is in front a very big commercial center; therefore there are a lot of people who walk by. I’m asking for a loan of $ 1,200 to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

En mi negocio vendo ropa y tenis usados, pero me gustaría invertir en la compra de más cosas para vender y así poder tener más clientes y más ingresos, el lugar en donde estoy instalado es muy bueno ya que es una calle por donde pasa mucha gente debido a que enfrente esta un centro comercial muy grande. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Albert Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Albert Kodjo D. is a young man of 25 years; very dynamic. His main business is farming, including raising local breeds of swine. He is married and the father of one child. Today, he hopes to improve his pork business and enhance productivity to ensure the schooling of his child, which is unfortunately well beyond his financial means. He asks to this effect a loan of $1000 which will let him redo his pens and maintain veterinary care and food supply for his animals.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Kodjo Albert est un jeune de 25 ans, très dynamique. Il a comme activité principale l’élevage de porc de race local et l’agriculture. Il est marié et père d’un (1) enfant. Aujourd’hui, il a le souci d’améliorer son activité en faisant l’élevage de porc de race améliorée afin d’accroître ses rendements et assurer la scolarité de son enfant. Malheureusement ceci demande beaucoup plus de moyen financier. Il sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1000 qui lui permettra de refaire la bergerie, d’assurer les soins vétérinaires et l’alimentation des bêtes.

loans.use: Improve the breeding and selling of pigs on his farm

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
This young entrepreneur is a single mom with big dreams. With the help of her parents, she was able to start selling spices in Chinandega's central market. She was able to finish her studies and graduate from the Secretariado Ejecutivo, but due to how hard it is to find a job and the low wages, she decided to start her own business with her savings, about $200.00. Back then her stand was just a wooden table.

She continued saving her money over the 10 months she worked for a private company as a secretary and receptionist. She now supports her parents who still have their own stand right next to hers. This young girl, in addition to helping her parents with their business and at home, makes floral arrangements and piñatas. We believe it's very important to help this kind of you entrepreneurs whose initiative helps create more jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta joven emprendedora, es soltera sin hijos pero con grandes deseos de superación. Gracias a que sus padres desde hace varios años establecieron un modesto y humilde puesto de venta de especies en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega ella logra terminar sus estudios y se gradúa de Secretariado Ejecutivo, pero ante las dificultades de encontrar empleos y a los bajos salarios, decide iniciar su propio negocios mediante unos pequeños ahorros de US$ 200.00 dólares, en ese entonces el puesto era una pequeña mesa de madera.

Los ahorros fueron acumulados durante los 10 meses que laboró para una empresa privada como secretaria-recepcionista. Ella ahora sirve de apoyo para sus padres, los cuales aún poseen su puesto de ventas, el cual está ubicado junto al que ella posee. Esta joven, además de cuidar de su propio puesto ayuda a sus padres en el de ellos y aporta en el hogar. Además de vender en el mercado, la joven elabora en su casa de habitación Adornos florales y piñatas por encargo. Creemos que es importante apoyar a este tipo de jóvenes emprendedores, cuyas iniciativas generalmente se vuelven generadoras de empleo.

loans.use:
Purchase of goods (spices) and materials for piñatas

Compra de productos (especies) y materiales para piñatas

loans.name: Suati

texts.en: Suati L., aged thirty, is a loyal wife and a terrific mother to her four children.  She started a plantation as a way to earn extra money for her family.  In addition to her plantation, her husband has a job to help provide for the family. He is a taxi driver, but his wage is not nearly enough to cover all their expenses and make a better home for them.  Therefore, Suati applied for this loan in order to help her support her family and home.  She will use the money to improve their plantation and provide good crops for the family to sell and to consume.  When they sell their crops, they will have enough money in their hands for expenses and for their home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for home improvement

loans.name: Hartati

texts.en: Hartati is  a 35-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice, and many other things. She can earn US$ 44.50 per month, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Hartati is requesting a US$ 75 loan to buy more inventory for her shop. Her husband, N., has no regular income, so she has to work hard to cover the family's daily needs and her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her little "corner grocery shop"

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
"I have lived all my life in the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of nine: six boys and three girls. I sew clothes to supplement my husband's income. Until now, my husband used to transport goods on a donkey cart, but now he wants to buy a rickshaw and requires a loan for this purpose.

I would like to borrow in a group with several other women. I want them to get loans so that they can also make their lives better. My loan group members are: Sajida B. who requires a loan for her husband’s motorcycle workshop; Rubina B. who will invest the loan in their grocery store; Musawer B. who also needs to buy a rickshaw; and Amtulaziz B. who wants to start a grocery store."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor´s current work was an initiative of her sister who, because of a trip, left the business to her. Prior to this Flor worked with her husband as a fare collector in a public transport line. This work, although it generated income, left her very tired at the end of the day. As the years went by she began to look for another job and her sister´s trip was a coincidence. She gladly accepted the fruit stand her sister left her. She has been selling fruit and orange juice now for two years. Thanks to this work she is helping to build and maintain her house. What she would like most of all is to fix up the stand that she has, as it has deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El actual trabajo de Flora en un inicio era de su hermana, quien por motivos de viaje, se lo dejo a ella. Anteriormente, Flor trabajaba junto a su esposo como cobradora de una línea de transporte público. Este trabajo, si bien le generaba ingresos, al final del día ella terminaba muy cansada. Con el paso de los años ella empezó a buscar otro trabajo y el viaje de su hermana fue una coincidencia. Así que acepto con mucho gusto manejar el puesto de frutas que se le concedió. Ya lleva dos años vendiendo frutas y jugo de naranja. Gracias a este trabajo está ayudando en la construcción de su casa y al mantenimiento de esta. Lo que ella más quisiera es poder arreglar el puesto que tiene, ya que esta degradado por el tiempo.

loans.use: Remodel her stand.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Despite her economic situation, Antonia has always had a strong desire to overcome life's challenges. Antonia, a loving mother, grew up in a modest home in the Vila Vila district, about 95 kilometers from where she now lives in the city of Juliaca. Ever since she started a family of her own she has fought hard to provide security and well-being for her three children, who are a source of great pride and happiness. She has worked constantly, buying and selling livestock (sheep and pigs). While this hardworking mother dedicates her time to this activity, her husband also works hard, tirelessly providing transportation services with his only means of transportation, a tricycle taxi. With much perseverance, both Antonia and her husband are finally achieving their goal of improving their family's quality of life. In light of the high demand for her products, Antonia would like to increase her investment capital. She kindly asks that you consider helping her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia, pese a su condición económica siempre demostró un gran deseo de superación. Esta dulce madre proviene de un humilde hogar del distrito de Vila Vila a unos 95 kilómetros de la ciudad en la que radica, Juliaca.Desde que formó su familia siempre ha luchado por el bienestar y seguridad de sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes se convirtieron en su mayor orgullo y alegría, trabajando constantemente en su actividad de compra y venta de ganados ( ovejas, chanchos).Mientras esta empeñosa madre se dedica a su noble labor, su hacendoso esposo trabaja incansablemente brindando servicios de movilidad, en su única herramienta de transporte su triciclo. Ambos con mucha perseverancia finalmente están logrando el propósitos de incrementar su nivel de vida y la de sus pequeños retoños.Doña Antonia viendo la demanda del mercado desea aumentar su capital de inversión, es por ello que recurre gentilmente a tu persona.

loans.use: Increase in investment capital.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz comes from a family that specializes in handmade embroidery and for as long as she can remember she has been involved in this work. She has received training and developed her skills since she was a little girl. Now that Luz has reached adulthood, she is ready to earn a living doing this work. She sells her embroidery to dance troupes which are common in many schools and high schools in her region.

Luz would like to increase her embroidery sales, with the goal of putting the additional income toward the education of her six-year-old daughter, who is studying in a prestigious primary school. To improve her embroidery she needs to acquire different colored threads and wool, which, when purchased in large quantities, are less expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Luz proviene de una familia que se dedica a los bordados artesanales y siempre ha estado ligada a este trabajo por esa razón su entrenamiento y habilidad se desarrolló desde su niñez y ahora que es una persona adulta esta preparada para afrontar la vida con esta ocupación. Oferta sus bellos bordados a los elencos de danza típica de las diversas escuelas y colegios de su zona, y su deseo es ampliar sus posibilidades de ventas a fin de solventar satisfactoriamente con las ganancias que obtenga de su inversión la educación de su pequeña hija de 6 años que está estudiando en una prestigiosa escuela de educación primaria, para poder mejorar sus bordados requiere adquirir hilos de diversos colores y lana en grandes cantidades ya que a mayor cantidad menor es el precio.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and wool in various colors

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Pictured above is 28 year-old Stella N.. She is married, and has two children. In 2002, Stella established her crop wholesaling business. Stella requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This serves as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Hikmatrullo.

texts.ru:
Hikmatrullo M. lives in the Gissar area. He is involved with the trading of food. He owns a store a the local area market. He has been involved with this type of business for 25 years. He wants to increase commodity circulation so that he can change the assortment of his goods. To accomplish this he has planned to take out a loan and repay it within 12 months. Hikmatrullo is married and has 4 children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Хикматулло прожвает в районе Гиссар. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет магазин на рынке района . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 25 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот для того , чтобы изменить ассортимент товара. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит со сроком в 12 месяцев. Хикматулло женат и имеет 4 детей.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Saada owns and operates a business whereby she cooks and sells food in Zanzibar. She is 46 years old, married, and has seven children (ages 4, 6, 8, 14, 16, 20, and 22). On a daily basis, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business. In doing so, she is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $100.

Saada is now seeking a loan to buy more materials for her business. In addition, she will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a business in the food production/sales industry.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Doris Olivia

texts.es:
Doris de  23 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos” de Catac, ella busca su independencia, e implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, la relación con su conviviente no le ha sido muy placentera, con quien tiene dos hijos menores, él trabaja en una planta minera como obrero.
Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas , y nos dice que es difícil vender en Catac este producto, porque son muy pocos los compradores, quienes  por el frío no salen en la noches, es por esta razón que solo lo hace en fechas festivas.
Con el préstamo de S/ 300 soles ,que pagará en 4 cuotas, ella comprará dos sacos de papas y una caja de aceite para vender en fiestas patrias su producto.

loans.use: Compra de papas al por mayor.  Otros insumos.

loans.name: Fiorela Katherine

texts.es:
Fiorela es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.

Fiorela es soltera y tiene 19 años, Fiorela vive en la casa de sus padres y estudia enfermería en la universidad, en algunas oportunidades trabaja a medio tiempo en boticas, también realiza servicios de aplicaciones de inyectables a domicilio. Fiorela implementó un pequeño tópico en su casa donde brinda servicios de primeros auxilios, vende algunos documentos y también tiene una fotocopiadora, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama.

Fiorela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos y materiales para el tópico. Los sueños de Fiorela son culminar sus estudios, estudiar una maestría y tener una farmacia bien surtida.
texts.en:
Fiorela is a member of "Banco Comunal Wiñarisun". Wiñarisun means "Let's grow" in Quechua.

Fiorela is single and 19 years old. She lives with her parents and study nursing at the university. Sometimes she works half-time in pharmacies and she also gives injections at home. Fiorela has a small facility at home where she gives first-aid, sells some documents, and she also has a photocopy machine. She is assisted by her mother.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy medicine and material for her first-aid services. It is Fiorela's dream to finish her studies, study a master's degree, and own a well assorted pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicine and material for her first-aid services.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine Sangaré est un jeune de 27 ans qui vit avec sa femme et ses 2 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Sido Sonincoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant très tôt abandonné l’école coranique il s’adonna au métier de jardinier, grâce à laquelle activité il génère son premier fonds de commerce. Monsieur Sangaré fait la vente des huiles alimentaires depuis maintenant 6 ans. Jouissant d’une très grande popularité auprès des femmes fréquentant le marché Château de la ville de Ségou, il vend exclusivement en détail à l’aide d’une pompe manuelle qui lui sert d’instrument de mesure (Chaque tour de la manivelle coûte 100 FCFA la monnaie locale).
Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite le concours de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 600 litres d’huile alimentaire (soit trois fûts d’huile) auprès des commerçants grossistes sur place au grand marché de la ville de Ségou.
Monsieur Lamine Sangaré vend au comptant ou à crédit au marché château de Ségou sous un hangar à une clientèle composée généralement de ménagères et de restauratrices. En raison de l’augmentation régulière de sa clientèle  monsieur Sangaré pense devenir dans les années à venir une référence dans son domaine à Ségou.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine Sangaré is a 27-year-old young man who lives with his wife and his two children in a traditional family along with other married couples in the Sido Sonincoura district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having abandoned Koranic school very early on, he dedicated himself to the gardening profession. Thanks to that work, he generated his own capital fund. Mr. Sangaré has been selling cooking oil for six years now. Enjoying tremendous popularity with the women who visit the Château marketplace in the city of Ségou, he sells exclusively at the retail level and uses a hand pump as a measuring device. (Each turn of the crank costs 100 francs CFA, the local currency). To satisfy the demand from his continuously growing customer base, he is requesting the assistance of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is on his first individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy 600 liters of cooking oil (being three drums worth) from wholesale merchants locally at the grand marketplace of the city of Ségou. At the Château marketplace of Ségou, Mr. Sangaré makes his sales out of a shed to customers generally composed of housewives and restaurateurs, cash or credit accepted. Because of the regular increase of customers, Mr. Sangaré is thinking of becoming a reference in his domain in Ségou in the years to come.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath N. is a villager in Traov Em Village in Takeo Province. She is a breeder who raises chickens and pigs. 

Since her businesses are going well, she wants to expand, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chickens and two piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Touch Chanthorn, is a farmer who has a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

Mrs. Sambath N. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is electrician while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and two piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Akongo

texts.en:
Akongo R. sells beans at the market and is requesting a loan to construct a house. Akongo is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children, none of whom go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To construct a house for her family.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.es: El señor Bismarck Busto A. tiene la edad de 29 años habita en el barrio San Ignacio ubicado en la Concepción, juntos a sus padres, el es soltero, los planes a  futuros es mejorar la producción para obtener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el desde hace veinte años trabaja como agricultor ya que sus padres desde pequeños le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Los sueños de este Joven es llegar a establecer más cultivos para poder hacer su casa ya que tiene planes de formar una familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo va invertir en fertilizantes para el cultivo ay así vender una buena producción al mercado y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Bismarck Busto A. is 29 years old and lives with his parents in the San Ignacio neighbourhood of la Concepción. He is single. He plans to improve his yield so that he can make more money and improve his living conditions. For 20 years he has worked as a farmer as his parents taught him at a very young age to work the land. This young man dreams of growing more crops to have his own home as he wants to start a family. He will invest this loan in fertilizers to be able to sell a high quality crop at market and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil additives such as fertilizers and pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheun H., 44, and her husband, Mr. Huot Hin, 41, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1992 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom attend school.

Kheun and her husband have been farming for 29 years. They grow cucumbers, green beans, and jasmines. They sell them at the Prek Phnao market. Kheun hopes to support her children so they can attend the university. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to use for growing cucumbers and green beans and to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To use for growing cucumbers and green bean and to build a kitchen

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Von A., 26, is a local motorcycle taxi driver. He provides his taxi service for local villagers and passer-by, and can earn an average of $3.50 per day. Von A. is a single man who is very responsible to his family and he currently lives with his old mother, who is a rice farmer in Kompong Tom Province. Von A.'s business is going well but recently his old motorcycle frequently breaks down so he can't attract additional clients. Therefore, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace his old broken machine.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata S., Ya Kaday T. and Fatu C.. They named their group One Way. Previous loans have had meaningful impacts on their lives. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.
