Fatmata S. (middle) is the leader of the group. Fatmata is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married to an architect and the two of them have three children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II), another is in class four, and the last is not of school-going age. Fatmata sells market food in Makeni's second largest market. She has been in the market food business since childhood. With this loan, Fatmata will buy gallons of cooking oil, a bag of onions, a carton of “margi” and two cartons of tomatoes.  

Fatmata faces no major challenges in her business. Business is going on fine and well for her. She enjoys doing her business and would like to see it grow. Her business is the only source of income for Fatmata. From this business, she and her husband pay for the children's schooling, feed the family and solve most of the household problems.

loans.use: To invest in a food-selling business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 49 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has been selling car parts and accessories for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and other people from his region. Mahmoud hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Muhtasar

texts.ru: Мухтасар 35 лет. она занимается покупкой косточек от абрикосов и затем дальнейшей их переработкой. Ядра от косточек, которые она вместе с семьей раскалывают дома она сортирует и затем реализует на рынках. Доход от этой деятельности небольшой, и поэтому кроме бизнеса Мухтасар работает в одной организации. Она собирается немного расширить свой бизнес и поэтому обратилась с заявкой на КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhtasar is 35 years old. She purchases apricot pits and processes them. She sorts and then sells at markets the kernels from the pits, that she splits with her family at home. The income from this occupation is not large and this is why in addition to her business Muhtasar works in one organization. She plans to grow her business a little bit and this is why she has applied to KIVA

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Emillienne

texts.fr:
O. Emillienne est née le 27 Février 1974. Emillienne est originaire de BANTE un village du Département des COLLINES dans le Centre du BENIN. Emillienne est mère de trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles tous scolarisés. Emillienne a divorcé depuis trois (3) ans et a la charge de ses trois enfants. Emillienne vit avec ses trois enfants en location à AHOUASSA un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Depuis onze (11) ans Emillienne vend la bouillie de maïs et les beignets de farine de blé dans un lycée de la place. Pendant les vacances le niveau de l'activité de Emillienne baisse très sensiblement. Pour pallier à ce état de chose Emillienne décide de diversifier son activité avec la vente de tissus pendant les vacances. C'est dans cette optique que Emillienne sollicite un troisième crédit de la part de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
O. Emillienne was born on February 27, 1974. She traces her roots to Bante, a village in Collines County, in central Benin. She is the mother of three children (1 boy and 2 girls) who are all in school. She has been divorced for three years and supports her three children. She lives with them, renting in Ahouassa, a working-class district of Cotonou City, the economic capital of Benin.

For eleven years, Emillienne has been selling cornmeal porridge and beignets made of wheat flour at a local high school. During vacation periods, her business activity drops quite noticeably. To remedy this situation, she decided to diversify her business by selling fabrics during vacation periods. With this in mind, she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, a sack of corn, and a sack of wheat flour

loans.name: Khalid Parveen Muhammad Afghan Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Multan is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he runs a clothes-selling business.

Khalida baji also has a clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes on orders which she collects from her neighbors. She charges $2 per dress. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount.

She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she is able to sew the clothes on time.

The other member of the group, Aziz mai baji, wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda M. is 26 years old. She is a widow and has a little son. For almost 5 years now, Mavluda has had a beauty salon business. Every day she services many brides. In general, she offers bridal gowns, manicures, pedicures, make-up, and hair styles. Her salon is always full of clients, because she does her job professionally. She wants to take out a loan to expand her business. She wants to buy additional equipment and goods for her beauty shop. Mavluda likes her job very much, because she likes to see the smiles of happy brides every day .   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods for beauty salon.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 47 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been selling provisions and drinks for the past 3 years. Elizabeth is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Udoka

texts.en: Udoka is 23 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells sarongs. She hopes for a loan amounting to NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is a LAPO client and promises to pay back. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita T. (0) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo Tai. She is married and has three infant-aged children. Lita owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2009, Lita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lita is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina I. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Georgina sells sauce pans and groceries at Cape Coast, which she has done since 1996. Her husband is a supplier. Georgina uses her income to pay for upkeeping of her family. Georgina will use the loan to purchase to buy more sauce pans and groceries for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase to buy more sauce pans and grocery items for resale at the market

loans.name: Bernita

texts.es:
La señora Bernita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 50 años, y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun están bajo su poder y están estudiando.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Bernita, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bernita, belongs to the Communal Bank “Picota,” Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 50 years old and married, a mother of 3 children, of which 2 still live with her and are attending school.

Her strength and determination to give her children a better future motivated her to start her own business by selling groceries. The store is located in her home, an environment that is very well set up to take care of her customers.

The profits that she makes daily help her improve the economic revenue of her family. Since the beginning up to today she has earned many recurring customers who daily go to her store as she has all the products that a housewife needs and she personally takes care of each customer with the kindness and enthusiasm that characterizes her.

With this loan of S/ 2,500.00, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, spaghettis, salt and oil in packets, milk and boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, eggs, and articles of personal hygiene in order to continue giving the best service to her customers.

Bernita feels very happy to continue working and prepares for each day to deal with the challenges that life presents. She gives thanks to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for helping women like her have the opportunity to develop in whatever means they use to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to increase her product stock.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: G. Gisèle est née en 1969 à Porto-Novo, Capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à GODOME Daniel revendeur, et mère de cinq enfants, Gisèle réside à Abomey-Calavi au Sud du Bénin. Gisèle et son mari supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Gisèle vend le charbon de bois et les divers (pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de conserves, savons, haricot) à son domicile à Abomey Calavi.  C’est à Dantokpa à Cotonou, grand marché international du Bénin que Gisèle achète ses produits de commerce. Gisèle a déjà 10 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Gisèle ambitionne augmenter le volume de son activité, mais il lui manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est la raison pour laquelle Gisèle s’est rapprochée de ALIDé pour obtenir de financement.

loans.use: Achat de 40 sacs de charbons de bois

loans.name: Sylvie Véronique

texts.fr: Sylvie Véronique est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et a 06 enfants scolarisés en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 4 ans et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Elle développe un petit commerce de miel et d'huile de palme. Avec ses bénéfices elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Sylvie Veronique is a 41-year-old woman. She is maried and has 06 children to take care of in school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for 4 years and has benefitted from 8 loans which she has repaid without problem. She does petty trading in honey and palm oil. With her income, she supports her husband in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To beef up her petty trading business

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando, 53, is a rice farmer. He is married and has seven children. He takes good care of his farm. He said that his last harvest was good and he aims for the next harvest to be better. But he is still short of capital to fund his farm. To supply his financial need, he joined CEVI, a Kiva partner, and applied for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. He will use this loan for the farm inputs lacking at his farm and also to pay the laborers who help at his farm. Receiving this loan is truly useful for him because he will now achieve the kind of harvest he wants.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Bélgica Vanessa

texts.es:
Bélgica Vanessa C. M. es una joven señora de 23 años de edad la cual vive con su pequeño hijo y con su madre en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde muy joven Bélgica se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdo para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy bien.

Actualmente Bélgica está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento entre otros insumos necesarios para que su negocio salga adelante Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Bélgica es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Bélgica Vanessa C. M. is a 23 year old young woman. She lives with her small child and her mother in the Hernández community located in Los Chiles in the Aljuela province. This community stands out for its mountainous regions with great scenery. It is very humid, and it is very close to the northern border of the country. It primary economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, tubers, and oranges. Ever since she was a young girl, Bélica has raised pigs to fatten them. She sells her products to the neighbors in the community. They are very satisfied with her products. She says that since she started this project she has felt very good. Bélica is currently asking for a small loan for ¢ 670,000 (six hundred seventy thousand colones) to buy more pigs to fatten. She will also buy food and other supplies necessary to get her business ahead. With this investment she expects her small business to grow in order to take care of more customers and offer them better products. All of this will help improve living conditions for her and for her family. Bélica is a member of the United Community Credit Enterprise for Development, one of the 100 partner organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She would like to offer her thanks to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that enable her to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, la señora Salvadora R. con mucha dedicación ha laborado arduamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar el cual está compuesto por su pequeño hijo al que tiene que brindarle los estudios ya que está en edad escolar y ella es una dama soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a este pequeño.

A sus 46 años, ha logrado llevar el sustento  a su hogar y destacarse como una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de las dificultades económicas que atraviesa, siempre está dirigiendo su hogar con responsabilidad. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos para luego ofrecerlos a los posibles clientes porque piensa que con estas ventas que haga logrará solventar algunas necesidades del hogar para continuar brindándole  a su hijo un techo digno que preste las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo como persona y un lugar seguro donde poder habitar.
texts.en:
In the department of Estelí, Sra. Salvadora R. works hard and with great dedication to provide a home for her young son and give him an opportunity for an education since he is of school age. She is a single mother and bears the responsibility of supporting her young child.

At 46 years of age, Salvadora has managed to maintain her home and be a working mother despite facing financial difficulties. She has always conducted herself responsibly as the head of her household. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics to sell to prospective customers. Salvadora believes these sales will help her cover a few household necessities. As a result, she will be able to provide a decent and safe home for her son and give him the necessary conditions to develop as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is 33 years old. She's from Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. She has a farm, and rice is her main crop. She started tilling when she married a farmer.  Until now, she continually farms because it is her only source of livelihood. She has one child who is 8 years old.

She is applying for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In this way, she will be sure that her plants are taken care of well. She also hopes that the loan will bring her a better harvest and more income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Héctor Leonel

texts.es:
El trabajo ambulante requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el motivo de que se expone al sol y se debe de caminar largas distancias para realizar las ventas. Consciente de esto, el señor Hector P. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la actividad de venta de queso y de crema en el municipio de Telica ofreciéndolo en diferentes lugares con el fin de obtener las ganancias para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
El señor Hector muy sabiamente hace uso de su bicicleta para andar ofreciendo el queso en los diferentes lugares. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de dicho queso para continuar con su venta con la alegría que siempre lo ha caracterizado.
texts.en:
Traveling for work takes considerable effort and requires being exposed to the sun and walking long distances in order to make sales. Sr. Hector P. is aware of what it takes and is willing to invest great effort into his business selling cheese and cream in the town of Telica. He travels to different locations so that he can earn the money needed to support his household.

Sr. Hector makes wise use of his bicycle when selling his cheeses in different places. This loan will be used to purchase more cheese so that he can continue his sales. Hector is always known for his cheerful demeanor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese to sell

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es:
Argemiro M. tiene 64 años y vive en Cartagena de Indias,  trabaja con su hijo de 29 años y juntos venden herramientas, repuestos y accesorios para vehículos de carga pesada en un tenderete en el barrio de El Bosque cerca de la oficina de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en Cartagena. Argemiro  solicita un crédito de $2.000.000 y quiere invertirlo en aumentar las compras de  cadenas, raches, grilletes y gatos para tractomulas que son los artículos que más le piden y de los que tienen mayor costo.

Comenzó su negocio vendiendo puerta a puerta por las calles del barrio El Bosque acompañado de su único hijo. Al inicio vendía productos como candados, relojes y gafas, pero a medida que se fue capitalizando comenzó a vender las mercancías que maneja actualmente. Ha tenido cuatro créditos anteriores con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que le ayudaron a capitalizar su negocio y así pudo ubicarse de manera estacionaria en una esquina en el mismo barrio que queda cerca de varias empresas de transporte de carga pesada. Por su buen trato, amabilidad y responsabilidad fue conquistando la clientela ubicada a su alrededor, que son en su mayoría dueños de las tractomulas y así posicionó su negocio en el punto donde se encuentra hoy. Los créditos de la Fundación le han dejado más ganancias y más ingresos familiares con los que ha podido mejorar su vivienda y generar ingresos que mantenga   trabajando a él, su  hijo,  nuera  y nietos.

Como su tenderete está en un espacio público,  que siempre mantiene limpio y ordenado y cuenta con el apoyo de las empresas a sus alrededores, siente temor que puedan quitarlo de este sitio. Por eso su meta es conseguir un local donde sus ingresos puedan cubrir el arriendo, que esté ubicado en un sitio amplio y cercano  para mantener más variedad de productos y adquirir otras líneas que tengan conexión con el mercado con el que trabaja actualmente. Otro sueño suyo es de seguir mejorando la vivienda donde viven su familia y él.
texts.en:
Argemiro is 64 years old and lives in Cartagena de Indias. He works with his 29 year old son and together they sell tools, parts and accessories for heavy cargo vehicles in a stall in the neighborhood of El Bosque near the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo office in Cartagena. Argemiro seeks a credit of $2.000.000 COP and wants to invest in a large purchase of chains, belts, shackles and tracks for tractor-trailers because they are the articles that are most asked for and most expensive. He began his business selling door to door in the streets of the neighborhood of El Bosque accompanied by his only son. At the beginning he sold products like padlocks, watches and glasses, but as a capitalizing man, he began to sell the merchandise that he currently sells. He has had four previous credits with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that have helped him to capitalize his business and this is how he was able to establish himself on a single corner in the same neighborhood that is close to various transportation and heavy cargo businesses. For his good treatment, kindness and responsibility he has won over the clientele in his area, the majority of whom are owners of tractor-trailers and this his how he positioned his business as it is today. The credits from Fundación have given him greater earnings and more family income with which he has been able to improve his household and to generate income to maintain the work of he and his son and daughter and grandchildren. As his stall is in a public space, he always keeps it clean and orderly and has the support of the businesses in the area, he is afraid that they would make him leave this site. Because of this, his goal is to find a place where he can afford the lease and that is located in a place that is spacious and close so that he can maintain more variety in products and to acquire other lines that have connection with the market that he works with. Another dream is to continue improving the house in which he and his family live.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the purchase of chains, belts, shackles and tracks for tractor-trailers.

loans.name: Juana Nelly

texts.es:
Juana V. de 63 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. 

Juana empezó cocinando desde muy pequeña con su mama, cuando dejo de tener un empleo estable decido tener su propio restaurante.

Juana ahora trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 15h00 todos los días, algunas de las comidas que prepara es arroz con pollo, tallarines, carmes con menestras. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las lluvias de la temporada.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para construir y adecuar mejor su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
Juana V. is 63 years old. She lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil along the Perimetral ring road. Her house is made of cement and has only basic electrical and water connections. Juana started cooking alongside her mother when she was very young. When she no longer had a stable job, she decided to open her own restaurant. Now, Juana works every day from 10 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. The meals she prepares include chicken with rice, noodles, and beef with beans or lentils. One of the complications she is facing is the heavy seasonal rain. With the loan, she would like to buy cement, stones and sand to construct and equip her business more effectively. In the future, she would like to operate a good restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, sand and stones to reinforce her restaurant

loans.name: Szana

texts.en:
Szana is 30 years old and married to a spare parts dealer. She is a member of LAPO Microfinance and has maintained a good relationship for some years now. Szana sells 'fairly used' clothes to make a living and has been in the business for the past six years.

Szana is asking for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more fairly used clothes to sell, as this will enable her to get a better discount and more profit on each sale. She said this will also give her a better opportunity to save for the future. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ailima

texts.en:
Ailima M. is 45 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ailima has many years of experience in this business.  Ailima needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.  Ailima wishes to extend her business as she applies for another fund to assist her development.

Ailima joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ailima's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios es Amor inicia su quinto ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Pilpichaca, la comunidad se dedica en mayor proporción a la ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. golosinas, D. comida, tienda D. abarrotes, ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Mery que es casada, tiene 7 hijos que están estudiando, Mery tiene un kiosco en donD. venD. comida y golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara golosinas variadas, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y su sueño es aumentar su negocio y que todos sus hijos sean profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total D. 7,100 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dios es Amor is commencing its 5th loan cycle with 10 members. The members are from the community of Pilpichaca, and the majority of the community works in agriculture. The members perform different activities such as selling sweets, food, grocery stores and agriculture. Such as the case of Mery, who is married with 7 children who are studying. Mery has a kiosk where she sells food and sweets, something she does every day. With the loan she is seeking she will purchase various sweets. In her communal bank she learned to save money and her dream is to increase her business and for all her children to be professionals. The members need different loan amounts such as 200 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, making a total of 7,100 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two children. She sells children's clothing and toys at one of the markets in Zaporozhye city. Nataliya enjoys her business. Seeing happy children when their parents buy them toys makes Nataliya happy as well.

Nataliya has been in this business for 10 years. She is a very open, sincere and responsible person. She says that business loans help her to purchase inventory in bulk and increase the assortment. This brings more customers to her kiosk and increases the sales. This time Nataliya would like to borrow 12,100 UAH to purchase more summer inventories.

loans.use: To purchase inventories

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad - Sallali. Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santísima Trinidad inicia su ciclo 1 con 7 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Sallalli, Distrito D.  Vinchos.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. la Señora Juana que es conviviente y tiene 8 hijos, Juana se dedica a la compra y venta D. quesos, Juana inicio su negocio con la venta D. cereales y quesos, que vendía en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y D. la ciudad compraba panes que vendía en su comunidad, Juana tiene proyectado implementar una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará abarrotes. Los sueños D. Juana son tener una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 100 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 1,600 soles.
texts.en:
The “Santísima Trinidad” (Holy Trinity) communal bank begins its first cycle with 7 members who are from Sallalli, Vinchos district. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. An example is Juana who lives with her life partner and their 8 children. Juana is a cheese merchant. She started out selling cereals and cheese in Ayacucho and she would bring back bread from the city to sell in her community. Juana plans to set up a grocery store in her home and will use the loan to buy stock items. Juana’s dream is to have a grocery store in her home. The members all need loans of varying amounts: 100 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, totaling a 1600 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime L. is a 54-year-old married man who supports his family through his fishing business. He lives in So. Lag-it, Bgry Capinyahan, Bais City, Negros Oriental with his wife and their 13-year-old child who is currently in school.
Jaime has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard in his fishing business, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 PHP.
Jaime is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to repair his fishing boat. This will be his fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of 10,000, PHP, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey towards economic freedom. Jaime aspires to elevate his family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 32 años, vive con Manuela (28), con quien tiene 4 hijos, juntos habitan su acogedora casa que es  propia.Sus pequeños hijos, lo impulsan para trabajar cada día desde muy temprano en busca de una producción fructífera, pues se dedica al cultivo de papa, desde  hace 10 años. Según sus palabras su pareja es más trabajadora que él, “con ella, puedo pensar en tener grandes cosas, porque es luchadora, y sobre todo ahorrativa, en la casa nunca nos falta que comer, porque sabe administrar bien el dinero” asegura. Lo que más le gusta es proporcionarle guano a sus sembríos, porque así los protege de las inclemencias del tiempo. Marcelo está agradecido con sus tierras fértiles, porque le permiten cubrir los gastos del hogar, por eso quiere continuar sembrando, pero en mayor cantidad, para brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está contento de laborar en su banco comunal, porque en todo este tiempo ha logrado ahorrar regular cantidad de dinero.Marcelo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes, insecticidas y plaguicidas, con los cuales asegurará sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 32 years old, and lives with Manuela (28), in their own cozy home with their four children. It is for their small children that they are driven to work every day from very early in the morning in search of fruitful production. He has been cultivating potatoes for 10 years. In his words, his wife is more hard-working than he is: "With her, I am able to think about having big things, because she is a fighter, and above all, thrifty. At home, we never miss eating, because she knows how to manage the money well," he assures.

What he likes most is to provide guano (a kind of fertilizer made from bird or bat dung) to his sown fields, because this way he can protect them from the inclemencies of the weather. Marcelo is grateful for his fertile lands, because they allow him to cover the expenses of the home, and for that he wants to continue sowing, but in greater quantity, in order to offer the best to his children.

This is the fourth time that he has a loan with MFP, and he is happy to work in his community bank, because in all this time, he has been able to save a fair amount of money. Marcelo has planned to invest the requested money in the purchase of several sacks of fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides, with which he can insure his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insectides for his crops

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun P., 35, lives in Mreah Prov village in Takeo Province where she cultivates rice upon a plot of land that she owns. She is also a grocery seller, and both enterprises enable her to earn a small income to support her family living. In order to increase family income, Savoeun wants to start a new business and is therefore requesting a loan to buy chickens and equipment to construct a chicken stall to support her new venture.

Savoeun's husband, Mr. Chan Mom, shown in the photo with her, is a construction worker earning a small salary. This couple has three children, all students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy chickens and equipment to make a chicken stall

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Ablavi D. is 40 years old and lives and works in Lomé, Togo. She sells a traditional Togolese dish called pâte, a sort of dough that is eaten with different kinds of meat and a spicy sauce. Madame D. usually sells her pâte with chicken. She has been in this business since 2000. 

She is married to a chauffeur and they have 4 children. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more supplies for making the pâte.  She will also use the funds to purchase casserole dishes and bowls that she uses to serve her meals to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase corn, dishes and bowls

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie P. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old and married with 3 adult children. To make a living, Tessie raises pigs for fattening and sale. She also does farming duties with her husband, helping him maintain their rice farm and also selling their harvest at the market and around their community.  Tessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting her 4th loan, for 12000 PHP, to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria vive en la comunidad de Cajamarca en el distrito de Chimayo provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus cuatro. La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura. Hace 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ella cría animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Victoria por las tardes y las mañanas se encarga de pastear, ordeña a los animales.  Victoria y su esposo Aurelio tienen una chacra donde producen maíz, papa, ellos llevan a vender sus productos  a las ferias y a los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Victoria que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Victoria pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Victoria lives in the community of Cajamarca, Chimayo district, Anta province, Cusco department with her husband and four children. The city of Cachinayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Victoria has been a farmer and has raised cattle for 17 years and does very well. She raises small farm animals like chickens and guinea pigs. During the mornings and afternoons she takes her animals to pasturage and does the milking. She and her husband, Aurelio, have a field where they grow corn and potatoes which they then sell in the farmers markets and in city markets in Cusco. Victoria expects to get 500 new soles in her next loan that she’ll use to buy seed and manure. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years and Victoria has been a member for three years and does well. The bank members are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is why they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and has employed two people from his community. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, and tea, all of which are sold at a local market. He also earns income from his brick selling business in the same location.

Richard is 50 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 5 children who are between the ages of 19 and 25. Two of them are currently attending school.

Richard has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family and help him pay school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of a lack of ready markets and too much rain, which affects his production.

He appreciates the services that he is receiving from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en: Maria Lourdes M. owns and operates a business making and selling specialty food products like fruit salad ice candy and steamed cake in her community. She is 26 years old, married and has four small children. They are from the village of Seaside, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. Maria Lourdes has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Maria Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en: K. Nurali is happily married to his wife. Their marriage has been blessed with five lovely children. Nurali has decided that he wants to live the rest of his life in the place where he was born. He not only loves the peaceful environment, but it is also home to their major source of income - farming. He has been involved in farm activities since childhood. He is used to the heat of the sun. Nurali has worked as a farmer for the past six years. However, life has been difficult and progress slow. Because he lacks financial resources, Nurali would like to borrow US$3,000 so that he can buy seeds and fertilizer for his crop and small cattle. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th century BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007 IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and small cattle

loans.name: Orhontuul

texts.en: Orhontuul P. is a 31 year old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in a rented yard. Her oldest daughter, age 11, attends a secondary school while her husband and son stays at home. They own 50 livestock and her husband goes back and forth between countryside and capital city of province to watch their livestock. Orhontuul operates a consumer goods trading business in her town. She started her business in 2009 by renting a small stall in the Central market to sell a variety of products after living in the countryside as a nomadic lifestyle. At first, the working capital was 1,000,000 MNT but soon grew to over 2,500,000 MNT. She moved to new trade center at where she continue to operate her trading business. She focuses on expanding her business further and sell more variety of products in the future. Orhontuul is a friendly and open minded person. She is requesting a  500,000 MNT loan, which she plans to use with her own cash 1,000,000 to purchase more inventory for the upcoming winter for her growing store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 37 years old and married with two children who are 9 years old and five years old. This family also takes care of one child who is a relative. Eric drives a taxi car and his wife does not work. This is his fifth successful year in his business operation and the hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Eric is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy equipment for his car. With this loan, Eric will be able to attract more passengers and he will be able to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for his car

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est une commerçante productrice de beignets très prisé par les ouvriers et chauffeurs de taxi clando dans la zone de Grand Mbour un quartier de Mbour. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce secteur. Pour le bien être de sa famille et la rentabilité de son activité Madame vient solliciter ce crédit pour l'acquisition de produits destinés à son fabrique
texts.en: Mrs. Fatou S. is a merchant who prepares and sells beignets, very popular with workers and unlicensed taxi drivers in the Grand Mbour area, a district of Mbour. She has over 10 years of experience in this area. In order to ensure the well-being of her family and the profitability of her business,  Mrs. S. is seeking a loan to purchase supplies necessary for her work.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan G. is a married man who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Pasil, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. He earns his living operating a fishing business.  His wife Mary Grace, 32, works as a vendor and also helps in her husband’s fishing activities. They have three children who are between three and eight years old. 

Allan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Allan has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of 18,000 PHP helped him earn a monthly profit of 11,500 PHP, raising his family's standard of living.  This time, for his tenth loan, he is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which he intends to use to purchase fishing gear and equipment so that he can continue to save up for the future education of his children. Allan G. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Sta. Ana Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama “STA. ANA” se encuentra ubicado en Santa Ana Estado de México; Está conformado por 9 integrantes entre ellas está la Sra. Marcelina Esperanza de 48 años de edad quien lleva  25 años de casada. Ella se dedica a vender colchas por catálogo y articulos de manualidades acordes a la temporada, comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio porque los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaban para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos. Ella desea salir adelante ya que tiene 6 hijos; 2 hombres y 4 mujeres y una depende economicamente de ella la cual esta estudiando la preparatoria y quiere terminar su carrera de diseño gráfico.
texts.en:
The group is called “SANTA ANA” and is located in Santa Ana, state of México.  It has 9 members.  

Among them is Marcelina Esperanza, 48.  She has been married 25 years and she sells catalogue comforters and seasonal crafts.  

She comments that she decided to start her business because her husband’s income sometimes wasn’t enough to cover all her children’s and her needs.  She wants to get ahead because she has 6 children, 2 boys and 4 girls and one of them still depends on her economically because she’s in high school and wants to finish a career in Graphic Design.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eloy; el tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de servicio de mototaxi (es realizar servicio de taxi pero con una moto), el trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de mototaxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una mototaxi.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eloy is a member of the communal bank, "Jose Carlos Mariategui." The bank is located in the Urubamba district of Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Eloy is 27 years old, is single, and has one child. He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as a mototaxi driver (ie taxi service but with a motorcycle). He works from 5:00 am to 10:00 pm. He would like to improve his mototaxi service and has requested this loan in order to purchase a mototaxi.

He is glad to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of a mototaxi (motorcycle taxi).

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel C. became a Solio agent in November; enabling him to lease solar chargers to ten members of his community.  So far, Daniel is enjoying his Solio products. His children are able to study for longer periods during the night from the Solio generated environmentally friendly light. The radio powered by the Solio has better reception than the one he was using before and he enjoys using it. Having the Solio has also raised his social status within the community from a mere Fundi to a man of Stima. Economically, Daniel has already started to save money by using the Solio as he no longer needs paraffin (kerosene lamp), batteries for a radio, or a torch and can now charge his own phone. Solio is Daniel’s first loan from Kadet.

loans.use: To purchase and resell solar powered products

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
la señora Blanca M. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Francisco de San Marcos, Blanca se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion.
Blanca vende su producto a todas las personas de su barrio en donde vive y al mismo tiempo le entrega a varios comedores del centro de la ciudad de San Marcos.
Blanca todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para poder producir toda la demanda que tiene y quedar bien con todos sus clientes.
su meta es seguir de esta manera e ir creciendo como microempresaria y poder sacar adelante a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca M. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Francisco de San Marcos. Blanca produces and sells tortillas, a business that she runs out of her home.

She sells her products to everyone in the neighborhood where she lives. At the same time, she delivers to different diners located in the central part of the city of San Marcos. Blanca wakes up early every day so that she can produce enough to meet demand and keep all of her customers happy.

Her goals include keeping her small business growing and moving her household forward.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime, water, and matches

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de llamadas telefónicas locales y nacionales, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio la socia se siente feliz ya que mediante esta actividad ella puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que ella trabaja de forma ambulatoria e independiente, la socia es una persona alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevos equipos de celulares para asi poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Ana has a business in which people can make local and national phone calls. She is happy to be engaging in this business because it enables her to spend more time with her children. Ana works as an independent street vendor. She is a cheerful person who has tremendous desire to succeed. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new mobile phone equipment so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Ana is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: Purchase new mobile phone equipment for her business

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S. is 30 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She owns a few rooms that she rents out to tourists who need to relax on their holidays. She also provides a food and soft drink service the whole day. Her husband manages their business. This couple lives with two children who are both teenagers and in school. In addition, they raise chickens to produce eggs and sell the eggs to people who come to buy them in bulk at their house. 

Sorn S. has applied for a $300 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional feed and chickens to raise and sell. This will provide her with additional profit, which she will use to better meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed

loans.name: Willington Ariel

texts.es:
Willington T. F. es un hombre de 33 años que vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 9 años; desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos cosméticos y también compra autónomamente otro tipo de mercancías como jeans, calzado, camisetas etc.; los  clientes de Willington en su totalidad están ubicados en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar donde vive; él se traslada en su motocicleta con facilidad y aprovecha las diferentes temporadas como la escolar, donde vende morrales, libros calzado; con el paso del tiempo la clientela ha ido creciendo pero su experiencia lo ha llevado a seleccionar a los mas puntuales para que su negocio sea cada vez mas rentables y estable.  
Su sueño es alquilar un local y abrirlo al público para separar su ambiente familiar de su ambiente productivo. Su mayor desafío es la competencia a la que con  su experiencia ha logrado controlar, por eso siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevos mercados, así como también de buenos precios para establecer negociaciones convenientes a sus clientes y buen resultado para  su negocio que tiene un margen de utilidad promedio de un 30%, mientras sus cuentas rotan cada 60 días. Willington en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva que es su primer crédito con la Fundación y con el cual planea comprar mercancías variadas y pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho teniendo en cuenta   productos de sus catálogos que se encuentran en ofertas entre los cuales están labiales, cremas, perfumes y cosméticos en general
texts.en:
Willington T. F. is a 33 year old gentleman who lives with his wife and two children, ages 2 and 9. For the past two years, he has been selling cosmetics through specialized catalogs, but he also works as an independent merchant who sells jeans, shoes, shirts, and other products. All of Willington’s customers live in the town of Puerto Colombia, where he also lives. He travels on his motorcycle with ease and takes advantage of different seasons, such as the start of the school year, to sell backpacks, books, and shoes. Over time his customer base has grown, but with experience, he has been able to select the customers who are most timely with their payments so that his business remains profitable and stable.

Willington dreams of renting a storefront and opening a shop to the public in order to separate his work environment from his family life. His greatest challenge is competition, but he has been able to keep it under control with experience. Willington is always looking for new markets and establishing negotiations to get the best prices for his customers. He has achieved good results in his business, including an average profit margin of 30% and product turnover every 60 days. Willington is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy different merchandise as well as products that his customers have ordered from the catalogs he carries. These items include lipsticks, crèmes, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase various types of merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino se dedica a la agricultura es casado con la Sra. Albertina ella Ama de casa pero le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura, el Sr. Marcelino  es nacido en Cochabamba. El 30 de Octubre de 1980 hace 12 años que vive y trabaja en Espejo a 10 km del Torno donde tiene su parcela y su pequeña casa de ladrillo en la cual trabaja sembrando Maíz, papa y arroz pero también tiene una fabrica de ladrillo, hace recientemente unos 6 a 7 meses que esta en proceso de ensamblarlo con maquinas a corriente, es una persona muy trabajadora, el dinero del crédito será destinado para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en: Marcelino works in agriculture. He is married to Albertina. She is a housewife and helps her husband with the farming. Marcelino was born in Cochabamba on October 30 of 1980. For 12 years, he has lived and worked in Espejo, 10 km from Torno. He has a land parcel with a little brick house, where he works planting corn, potatoes and rice. For about 6 or 7 months he has had a brick factory with power tools to make them. He is a very hardworking person. The money for the loan is destined for buying seeds to plant potatoes, or soil preparation. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and prepare the soil.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pacanga en Chepen, una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno lechero. Realiza esta actividad en un terreno cerca de su casa. Actualmente cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado. Desea usar su préstamo para la compra de más alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia. Es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Juan ha manejado otros préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. He lives in a rural part of the Pacanga district, in Chepen, one hour from the city of Chiclayo in the north of Peru. 

For five years he has worked raising and selling dairy cattle. He undertakes this activity on land near his house. Currently he works with four head of cattle. He wants to use his loan to buy more balanced food for his animals. For this he has decided to request a loan of 1000 new soles. The income he expects from this work will serve to meet his expenses and help with the economic maintenance of his family. 

He is father who is very dedicated to his family and is always concerned with their well being and development. Juan has managed other loans from Edpyme Alternativa and has repaid them in a punctual manner.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Jorge Emanuel

texts.es:
El joven Jorge V. de 19 años de edad, es soltero, cuenta con una casa de repuestos para automóviles de procedencia japonesa, anexo realiza carga de baterías.
Gracias a que trabaja puede solventar sus gastos y es estudiante universitario, pero además cuenta con la ayuda de su padre, quien es militar jubilado.
Solicita dicho préstamo a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva para la compra de aceite para tambores de automóviles, desea realizar la venta en una cantidad mayor para poder abastecer a los clientes.
Jorge agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de estar en el sitio web y presentar su caso, porque gracias a eso él podría conseguir la ayuda crediticia que necesita para poder seguir brindando servicios de buena calidad y a buen precio.
texts.en:
Jorge V. is 19 years old, single, and owns an auto parts shop where he sells parts for Japanese vehicles.  He also charges batteries.

Thanks to his work, he is able to cover his expenses.  Jorge is a university student but he also has the help of his father who is a retired soldier.  He is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that he can buy oil for vehicle drums.  He would like to be able to sell in larger quantities so that he can supply his customers.

Jorge is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity of appearing on their website and presenting his case because it means that he will be able to receive the loan that he needs in order to continue providing good-quality services to his customers, at a good price.

loans.use: to buy oil for vehicle drums

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es: El Señor Guillermo B. , tiene la edad de 47 años ;  habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , comarca la borgoña , junto a su esposa la cual se desempeña como comerciante de frutas para apoyarlos con los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen tres hijos a su cargo entre las edades de 18,14,10 años , el mayor le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas y los demás estudian y colaboran con diversas actividades del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar es sistema eléctrico de su vivienda ,  don Guillermo desde hace veinte años se dedica a  trabajar la tierra  , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son plagas y enfermadas en el cultivo de piña ya que estas carecen de fertilizante e insumos necesarios para poder obtener una fruta rica y de un buen color ; lo cual solicita Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva que se le apoye con un pequeño préstamo para poder darle vida nuevamente al cultivo y vender a un mejor precio .
texts.en: Mr. Guillermo B. is 47 years old. He lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the region of Borgona. He lives together with his wife who works as a fruit merchant to help with the household expenses. They have three children in her care, aged 18, 14, and 10. the eldest helps with the agricultural work and the others are in school and they help with household chores. His plans for the family are to improve the electrical system of their house. Guillermo has been working the land for 20 years. The greatest difficulty that he faces is the plagues and diseases that affect his pineapple plantation. His harvest is deficient in fertilizers and other materials that she needs to obtain a delicious fruit and of good color. He requests from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) through Kiva funding for support through a small loan. He will bring new life to his cultivation and he will be able to sell at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a 51-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is a farmer and tills her own land. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Herminia earns about 5,000 PHP from farming. She works hard and finds ways to improve her business and income. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gloria Narcisa

texts.es:
Gloria Narcisa tiene 42 años, Es viuda vive sola, tiene tres hijos pero todos son casados, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz desde hace 25 años además se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos, también para la alimentación de los animales.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es dejar buena herencia a los hijos.

Le gusta salir a pasear y hacer deporte con la familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Narcisa is 42 years old.  She’s a widow and lives alone.  She has three children but they are all married.  She lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Fría de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Gloria has been farming corn for the last 25 years.  She also raises small farm animals.  Her purchases take place in Ventanas and her sales occur at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure and also for animal feed.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are competition and weather variations.

Her dream is to leave a good inheritance for her children.  She enjoys going out on trips and playing sports with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure and also to feed the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Thes Jarrel

texts.fr:
Jeune commerçant de 27ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant âgé de 5ans. Ayant fini ses étude secondaire et n'ayant plus de soutien il débute son commerce avec la vente de boissons en 2007 avec un capital de 150.000 et se lance dans l'alimentation en 2008. Son revenu journalier est de 70000frs à 90000frs. Il a fait preuve d’une bonne gestion et d’un bon remboursement lors du 2e prêt.

Avec ce prêt troisième il aimerait agrandir son activité en achetant des cartons de lait, de boite de conserve, des friandises, des cartons de savons et des jus importés. 

Il à pour stratégie, d'ouvrir tôt afin d'être fidèle à l'accueil de ses clients, ouvrir un bon service, bien évaluer ses marchandises. Il veut épargner de jour en jour pour atteindre son but.

Il se bat pour l'épanouissement de sa famille et que ses enfants vivent dans des meilleures conditions. C’est un jeune qui est connu dans son quartier du petit au pus grand grâce à ses exploits.
texts.en:
A young entrepreneur, 27 years old, single and the father of a 5-year child. Lacking financial support after finishing high school, he launched a beverage selling business in 2007, with a starting capital of 150,000, and started selling groceries in 2008. His daily receipts are from 70,000 to  90,000. He manages his business well and repaid the previous loan properly.

With this third loan, he would like to expand his business in buying boxes of milk, canned [tinned] food, sweets, soap and imported juices. His strategy is to open early, offer a friendly welcome and good service and price his wares in a reasonable way. He would like to be able to save day to day in order to achieve his goals.
He is struggling to improve the well-being of his loved ones so that his [child] may have better life conditions. He is well-known by young and old in his neighborhood thanks to his business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk, canned food etc.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio es un padre de familia de 54 años de edad. Él vive junto a su esposa e hijo en una comunidad rural llamada Morropón en Piura. Esta familia goza de buenas referencias pues son muy unidos y trabajadores.

Ignacio se dedica a la compra y venta de cervezas. Este negocio le ha traído buenas recompensas que le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por ello que desea seguir invirtiendo en él y ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de cerveza y en otro negocio de compra de maíz en grano que luego comercializa.

Ignacio recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que realiza, las cuales son el sustento del hogar, es por ello que este crédito le sería de mucha ayuda a su familia.

Ignacio es un cliente recurrente de nuestra institución y goza de buenas referencias crediticias por su puntualidad a la hora de cancelar los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a 54 year old husband and father. He lives with his wife and son in a rural community called Morropón en Piura. This family has good references and is very close and hardworking.

Ignacio buys and sells beer. This business has brought him good earnings that have helped him improve his quality of life. That is why he wants to keep investing in it. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that he will invest in buying beer and for another business, kernel corn that he will later sell.  

Ignacio has the support of his wife in the activities that he does, with which he supports the home. That is why this loan would be a big help for the family. 

Ignacio is a recurring client of our institution and he has good credit references because he pays his loans off on time.

loans.use: to buy beer and kernel corn to sell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 51 years old and has a fish selling business. This business has been running for 33 years. Rufina's husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch at the market. She also buys directly from fishermen so she would have more fish to sell.

Rufina has 7 children, the oldest is 31 years old and the youngest 18.

Rufina earns about 8000 PHP per month and works hard to support her family.

Rufina has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, fish containers and more fish for sale. In the future, she hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, fish containers and more fish for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for her family. Susan runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store. Susan has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, eggs, noodles, spices, soap, etc. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Yenny Margoth

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Yenny tiene 35 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, la socia trabaja en su restaurante; la socia trabaja en el restaurante de su madre ubicado en el mercado Virgen Asunta, la socia ayuda a elaborar los diferentes menús a sus mama y los desayunos,  la socia desea el crédito para ayudar en la implementación de su restaurante y apoyar en la compra de utensilios y de sillas para el restaurante. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de utensilios y sillas para implementar su local.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Yenny is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, single, and has two children (ages 17 and 11). Yenny works at her mother’s restaurant, which is located in the Virgen Asunta Market. She helps with preparing different dishes that are from her mother’s recipes, as well as breakfast meals. Yenny would like a loan to help keep her mother’s restaurant in operation by purchasing utensils and chairs. Therefore, she is requesting the funds to use for this purpose.

Yenny is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and chairs.

loans.name: Ross Mere

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
