La  socia Ross Mere; tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hija, la socia  compra y vende productos de primera necesidad, la socia compra al por mayor de los almacenes grandes todo los productos que se venden en las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, la socia  compra al por mayor y los distribuye como preventista a cada una de las tiendas y bodeguitas de la ciudad, ella ya es conocida así que los clientes y dueños de las tienditas le llaman para solicitarle productos, la socia deja sus productos en dos partes,  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites en bidones, cajas de leche, mazamorras y otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank, which is located in the District of Huanchac, in the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.

The member is Ross Mere; she is 37 years old.  The member cohabits with her partner, and has one daughter.  The member buys and sells everyday products that she buys at wholesale at the large stores. She sells all her products to different grocery stores; she buys at wholesale and sells them to each one of the stores and small convenience stores in the city.  She is well known, and her customers and the managers of the small stores call her to request products.  She delivers her products in two parts.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing products such as rice, sugar, cans of oil, cartons of milk, porridge and other things.

The member is grateful for the help that's being offered to her, and at the same time agrees to comply with her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of products such as rice, sugar, cans of oil, cartons of milk, porridge, and other things.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
From Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Mrs. Im is a 60-year-old poor woman who tries to earn money to upgrade her standard of living. She has two single children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory as a domestic sewing worker and has a formal salary per month, while the other one is married and lives in a separate house.

Mrs. Im makes a daily income by selling different kinds of dry fish in the mobile place. From this, she is earning a profit approximately of 2.50 USD per day. She has many years experience in this business. As a result, she frequently gets more clients who come to order her dry fish to eat. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field as a chief of building workers. In order to add extra-income, Mrs. Im would like to borrow some loan funds from Kiva to purchase additional dry fish to sell.

In the future plan, Mrs. Im will be using the net income to raise her current business, and also to decorate her old house.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry fish to sell

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
This is Gil, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is single and manages his own household while operating the business.  At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. 

Gil operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, cartolina (heavy colored paper) and the like, without going to a bookstore. He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of school supplies to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Gil hopes to be able to expand soon .He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of school supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman aged 39 years. She is married and blessed with three children, who are still in school. She has been managing a tailoring business to earn a living. She also does farming to increase her income. She has employed two people to assist her to run the business. In the next five years, Margaret wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She has been selling women's accessories and beauty products since 2008. She works from her home where she welcomes customers to deal with them. With her loan request of 1,500 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., Hana will be able to increase her inventory of beauty products and accessories in order to attract more clientele. In the future, she hopes to open her own store.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of beauty products and accessories

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 17 and 16. In 1995, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Brylen

texts.en:
To earn a living, Brylen and her husband help each other to manage their corn farm. They are a young couple who live in a village with their parents. They planned to earn and save so that they will build their own house and live on their own. Both of them have no stable job and they are financially unstable; their parents are the ones who help provide some of their needs. In this regard, they planned to expand their corn plantation so that they will increase their yield and income.

Due to inadequate capital, Brylen is asking for an additional 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the corn farm. They believe that they will be able to improve their business if they continue to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the corn farm.

loans.name: Melipa

texts.en:
Melipa, 42, is married with five children. She is starting a business venture, selling pancakes in her village and needs a loan of $1000 Samoan Talas (WST) to purchase flour,sugar, cooking oil and a frying pan. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 US per week) to improve and expand the business.

Melipa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Melipa's first loan with SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.

loans.use: to purchase flour,sugar, cooking oil and a frying pan.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque quiere comprase más productos helados, como sorbetes, vasitos de sorbete, conos, paletas, entre otros, ya que esta inversión le ayudara para surtir de productos para los clientes, esperando que la demanda sea mejor y sus ganancias sean igualmente mejor.
El ha tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, hasta el momento se ha mantenido estable y ha logrado cubrir sus gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos decided to request a new loan because he wants to buy more ice cream products such as sorbets, sorbet cups, cones, popsicles, and other items. This investment will help him to restock with products for his customers. He expects demand to improve and that his earnings will increase as well.

Carlos had a good experience with his previous loan. To this point, he has remained stable and is able to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy sorbets, sorbet cups, cones, popsicles, and other products.

loans.name: Leddy Astrid

texts.es: La señora Leddy es madre de dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, es una emprendedora quien con el animo de generar sus propios ingresos para su sostenimiento y el de sus hijos, decide empezar su propio negocio de venta de ropa tal como camisas, camisetas, jeans, zapatos y ropa interior, esta labor la realiza desde hace dos años, vendiendo sus productos a sus amigos y familiares. La señora Leddy necesita de la compra de surtido de camisas, camisetas y jeans para poder tener productos suficientes para sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas  y generar mayores ingresos para su hogar. El sueño de la señora Leddy Astrid es brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener su negocio bien posicionado.
texts.en: Leddy is the mother of two children, 9 and 6.  She's an entreprenuer who decided to start her own business selling clothing such as shirts, t-shirts, jeans, shoes and underwear, so that she could earn money to help support herself and her children.  She has been doing this work for two years, selling the items to her friends and family members.  Leddy needs to buy an assortment of shirts, t-shirts and jeans to have enough merchandise for her customers, to increase her sales, and to generate more income for her home.  Leddy Astrid's dream is to enable her children to have a good education and to have a well positioned business.

loans.use: to buy a selection of shirts, t-shirts and jeans

loans.name: Fouisseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur FOUISSEYNI est né  en 1979 à Sanzana préfecture de SIKASSO. Père d’un garçon et marié à une femme, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à  LOULOUNI (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Il mène les activités d’achats et de ventes des ustensiles de ménage et divers articles tous en plastique depuis plus de 6 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes, notamment des tasses, assiettes, bouilloires, seaux, baignoires etc. 
Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il est rentré en  collaboration avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso y’a plus de 3 ans.Il  est a son sixième prêt maintenant et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des tasses, bouilloires, assiettes, baignoires et louches en plastique. Il s’approvisionne à SIKASSO. Acheminé à LOULOUNI, Les articles sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à Loulouni et ses villages environnants. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fouisseyni was born in 1979 in Sanzana in Sikasso prefecture. He is married and father to one boy, and he lives in a traditional family in Loulouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

He has been running a business buying and selling kitchenware and various other articles, all plastic, for more than six years. His experience in this field has earned him a good reputation and he receives orders notably for cups, plates, kettles, buckets and bathtubs etc. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy customer demand he began his collaboration with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, more than three years ago. He is now on his sixth loan and all five previous loans were repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to buy plastic cups, kettles, plates, bathtubs and ladles. He gets his supplies in Sikasso. Once they have been transported to Loulouni, the goods are stored in his shop. He resells them for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women in Loulouni and the surrounding villages.

With this loan he is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA. This profit will allow him to repay the interest on his loan and the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods

loans.name: Jimagilpe

texts.en:
Jimagilpe is 19 years old, single and lives in Tabid, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Jimagilpe operates a business in the agriculture sector, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 1,500 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

Recently, Jimagilpe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jimagilpe wants to make improvements to her house and to ensure the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 41 años de edad, es casada con un hijo.

Ella se ha dedicado durante toda su vida a realizar oficios domésticos, pero desde hace ocho años se dedica a trabajar en su granja de pollos de engorde, esta idea surgió de su hermana. Además ella posee una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su casa.

Blanca solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 200 pollitos, 4 quintales de concentrado de inicio, 16 quintales de concentrado final de engorde, vacunas, mejorar la galera donde tiene sus pollos y para comprar más productos para su tienda. 

Todo esto lo comprara en una ciudad del oriente del país que esta a cuatro kilómetros y medio de su hogar. Con esta inversión ella poseerá una granja mejor y fortalecerá su tienda, con lo que recibirá mayores ingresos, que parte de ellos los ahorrara, ya que desea brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Más adelante Blanca piensa en comprar cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos, realizarle mejoras a su casa, tener mucho más dinero ahorrado, abastecer las necesidades de su comunidad con su tienda y con la granja ya que en ese lugar no hay solo la de ella.
texts.en:
Blanca is 41 years old, married and has a son.  She has spent her life doing domestic chores but for the last 8 years has been working raising chickens, an idea that her sister gave her.  She also has a small, home-based store with basic household staples.

She asked Fundación Campo for a loan to buy 200 chicks, 4 quintals of start-up concentrate, 16 quintals of last-stage concentrate and vaccines; to improve the coops and to buy more products for her store.

She will buy all of this in a city in the east of the country that’s four and a half kilometers from home.  With this investment she’ll have a better farm and she’ll strengthen her store which will lead to better income.  She will save part of it because she wants to give her family a better quality of life.

Later on, Blanca plans to buy pigs to fatten up and sell, to do some home improvements, to have much more money saved, to meet her community’s needs with her store and the farm because in her areas hers is the only one.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks, 4 quintals of start-up concentrate, 16 quintals of last-stage concentrate, vaccines, to improve the coops and to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es:
Ruth trabaja como empleada atendiendo un negocio de lencería para adultos, el cual consiguió luego de mucho tiempo estar buscando oportunidades laborales; en su trabajo le permiten ofrecer mercancía de manera independiente, y Ruth quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para aumentar los ingresos de su hogar. Ruth es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, a quienes su padre abandonó desde hace un tiempo sin hacer ningún aporte económico, por lo que Ruth tiene la obligación de generar los ingresos que sean necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Ruth busca que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de ropa al por mayor para iniciar su propia venta de ropa, y así aumentar los ingresos que genera para su hogar.
Ruth afirma que de esta manera sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente, y de esta manera sus hijos podrán recibir una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Ruth sueña con que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de acceder en un futuro a una educación universitaria que les permita prepararse y obtener un empleo bien remunerado, por lo que trabaja fuertemente todos los días para cumplir este sueño.

loans.use: Compra de ropa al por mayor para iniciar su propia venta de ropa, y así aumentar los ingresos que genera para su hogar.

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Honorine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas scolarisé. Honorine vit avec son mari et son enfant. Les différentes charges de la maison sont supportées par Honorine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Honorine vend des boissons dans sa région depuis quinze ans environ. Honorine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Honorine ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons.

loans.name: Gbedokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Anne Marie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Stanislas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Anne Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Anne Marie et son mari. Anne Marie a très fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Anne Marie vend du maïs depuis sept ans. Anne Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Jeromana

texts.en: Jeromana, aged 24, lives in Iringa District, Tanzania. She is not married. Jeromana is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students life skills at the local school. These lessons help to build students’ understanding of themselves and how to succeed academically. Jeromana requests a Kiva loan to start a shoe selling business. She plans to use her profits obtained to expand her business and become the biggest entrepreneur in her village.

loans.use: to start a shoe selling business.

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.ru: 31 летняя прекрасная, умная и активная женщина это Гулхумор. Гулхумор бизнес – леди. Она занимается торговлей на магазине. Гулхумор на половине магазине продает мыло, стиральные порошки, а на остальной части магазина продает продукт питания. Она 3 года продвигает свой бизнес. Гулхумор только с помощью этой деятельностью обеспечивает ребенка. У Гулхумор есть один маленький ребенок. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Гулхумор ради ребенка так старается, чтобы кормить ребенка. Она хочет, привозит продукт питания, и увеличить товарооборот, Гулхумор надеется путем увеличения товарооборот увеличиться доход. Она хочет взять кредит и расширить деятельность. Поддержите ее достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
This is Gulhumor, a wonderful, clever and active 31-year-old woman. Gulhumor is a business lady. She sells things in a shop. Gulhumor sells soap and washing powders on one half of her shop, and on the remaining part of the shop she sells food products. She has pushed ahead with her business for three years. 

Gulhumor is providing for her child only with the help of her business. Gulhumor has one young child. Her husband is working in Russia in order to make a living. Gulhumor tries so hard for the sake of feeding her child. She wants to increase her goods turnover. Gulhumor hopes to increase her income by increasing her goods turnover. She wants to take a loan and expand business. Support her in reaching her goals!

loans.use: to increase her goods turnover and expand her business

loans.name: Nadjegueton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe NADJEGUETON 3 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
lls sont à leur 7ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
 La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Monsieur Mamadou en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3  hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village  et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 710.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm auto spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. H. is 26 years old and works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.  She lives with her husband (pictured here), a tuk tuk driver, and their 2 children.  Mrs. Sok S. H. earns $3/day and her husband earns $6/day.  This is enough income to support themselves, their children, and her two sisters.  This loan will be used to purchase a new tuk tuk for her husband so that he can continue to earn a good daily wage.  The old tuk tuk will then be rented out daily so that the family can earn additional income.  In the future, Mrs. Sok S. H. hopes to be successful enough to continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk for the family business

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José Alberto is a young entrepreneur, who started his own business sixteen years ago, offering his services as a hair stylist. He has always liked this craft and, as a means to grow, having his own beauty salon has become his dream. He started with just a mirror, a pair of scissors and a machine but, thanks to the good quality of his services, his clientele has multiplied and his business has grown, while he has been able to specialize in this type of services.

In order to offer an improved service in a better and more ample locale, Alberto is requesting a $925 loan, which he’ll invest in the renovation of his salon. He hopes to increase his capacity to serve clients and to continue growing, as he has done so far. You can be part of Alberto’s accomplishments and he is sincerely thankful for the help you are providing him.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

José Alberto es un joven emprendedor, quien desde hace 16 años inició su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista. Este oficio siempre ha sido de su agrado y para superarse se convirtió en un sueño para él tener su propia estética. Comenzó sólo con un espejo, unas tijeras y una máquina, pero gracias a la buena calidad de su servicio, pronto sus clientes se multiplicaron y fue creciendo su negocio y especializándose en este tipo de servicios.

Para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y tener un lugar más amplio y mejor, Alberto está solicitando un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local. Con esto espera aumentar la capacidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Tú puedes formar parte de los logros de Alberto y él agradece sinceramente la ayuda que le brindas.

loans.use: Renovation

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu T. is a hard-working woman of forty-nine years of age. She has six children; four are already married and three are still attending school. As she is about to turn fifty, she has worked so hard to support her husband with their plantation in order to get money to support their children. It is her first loan from S.P.B.D. and she is so grateful to get this help in order to help out with her business financially. Luafulu is looking forward to some more loans in the future in order to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy weed spray, knives, ladders, boots, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Thi Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai, 31 years old, is marriaged and has 3 children who are currently going to school. At the moment, her family is raising around 1,000 hens. Her daily income is above 150,000 VND (94 USD). She would like to request a loan to buy food for her hens. Everyday, her husband collects the eggs their hens produces as well as buying additional eggs from individual sellers (others families) in the village and then sell it to small retailers. She is planning to borrow money to expand her business (raise more hens).

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Mai 31 tuổi đã có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Hiện tại , gia đình chị nuôi gần 1,000 con gà đẻ. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình trên VND150,000. Chị vay vốn để mua cám nuôi gà. Chồng chị thường xuyên đi giao trứng của gia đình và thu gom trứng của các gia đình trong làng bán cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ. Chị có kế hoạch khi vay được nhiều vốn sẽ mở rộng chăn nuôi.

loans.use: To purchase food for chickens

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo E., born in Ghana, is 34 and the mother of three children. A seamstress by trade, she lives in Hédzranawoé in Lomé with her husband who is an automotive electrician. With the meager income she makes from her work, she helps her husband support the family and especially pay school fees for their children. She is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to refurbish her workshop and purchase new sewing machines and other equipment she needs for her work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Adjo E., née au Ghana est âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois (03) enfants. Couturière de profession, elle habite le quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé avec son mari, un électronicien auto. Avec le maigre revenu qu’elle retire de son activité, elle aide son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants et surtout leur scolarisation. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $800 pour rénover son atelier et acheter des nouvelles machines à coudre et d’autres matériels de travail dont elle a besoin pour mieux faire son travail.

loans.use:
Refurbishing of her workshop and purchase of new sewing machines

Rénovation d'atelier et achat de nouvelles machines

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Cossy is 45 years old, married and has eight children. Her husband has a retail shop. Cossy and Pauline are poultry farmers. Cossy usually earns about 150,000 shillings in profits weekly. With the extra business profit, Cossy intends to start up another business.

Pauline has a piggery business and wants to use the loan to expand the business.

Leo runs a small hotel and Jana provides tailoring services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 35 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Soc Son. She joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before, her family earned their stable income by the motorcycle-repairing workshop. After join the Fund, she combined the borrowed money with her savings to open a motorcycle store. Besides, she also provided warranty. Therefore, she always had a lot of customers. Currently, Mrs.T. is owning a motorcycle store right in the center of the town. Her average income is 700-800 USD/ month. Because the business is going very well, her 2 children are sent to school. They are now attending their last years of school. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more motorcycles, increasing store’s sale.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tình, 35 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Sóc Sơn. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Trước kia gia đình chị chuyên sửa chữa xe máy, thu nhập cũng ổn định. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ có điều kiện được vay vốn, cộng với số tiền tích lũy của gia đình chị Tình cùng chồng đầu tư buôn bán xe máy. Ngoài buôn bán, chị cũng bảo hành sửa chữa xe nên cửa hàng luôn đông khách. Hiện nay, chị có một cửa hàng buôn bán xe mới, cũ rất khang trang rộng rãi ngay trung tâm xã. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng của cửa hàng từ 700-800USD. Việc kinh doanh thuận lợi nên hai con của chị tình được bố mẹ tạo điều kiện cho học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay hai cháu đang học những năm cuối cấp. Vòng vốn chị xin vay 1200USD để mua bán xe máy, tăng doanh thu cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy motorbike

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
MAGDA, is a hard-working and self-sacrificing mother that always is alert of her home and of her children. She sells chickens in a small locality. She wakes up in the early hours to prepare the business and make tempting lunches. Because of her embarrassment and that she suffers from some inconveniences leaves her to live the same lifestyle that she had lived before. She also has suffered from some diminishing sales.She would like to open up her own restaurant dedicated to the sale of typical dishes in order to take advantage of hte market at the Rich Village and Oxampapa. She requests a loan to increase the quantity of chickens in order to initiate the whole sale distribution of it in little time.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

MAGDA, es una madre abnegada y trabajadora que siempre está pendiente de su hogar y de sus hijos. Por las mañanas vende en un pequeño local sus fresquísimos pollos que llegan a su hogar a muy tempranas horas para que ella pueda seleccionarlos y ofertarlos a las amas de casa para la preparación de sus apetitosos almuerzos.A consecuencia de su embarazo está sufriendo algunas molestias que sin duda no la deja continuar con el mismo ritmo de vida que llevaba antes pero hace el esfuerzo de desempeñarse lo mejor posible y disminuir sus ventas.Sin duda también hace mención que le gustaría poder abrir un restaurante donde dedicarse a la venta de platos típicos a fin de aprovechar la vía que divide Villa rica y Oxapampa. Solicita un préstamo para incrementar la cantidad de pollos que ferta a fin de iniciar en poco tiempo su repartición al por mayor.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor número de pollos.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a very hard-working and diligent woman that takes pains to maintain the economic stability within her home. She plants potatoes, corn and wheat in her fertile crop lands and although many times the losses from climatic changes have been substantial, she perseveres in her work because there are also very good times. She would like to adquire a larger quantity of chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

CATALINA, es una mujer muy empeñosa y muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por mantener la estabilidad económica dentro de su hogar, se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz y trigo en sus fértiles tierras de cultivo y aunque muchas veces la pérdida por los cambios climáticos ha sido cuantiosa, persevera en su actividad porque también hay épocas muy buenas. Desea adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para elevar la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Buying chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her products

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 22 year-old Roza C..  She is married, and has three children ages 4, 8, and 11. In 2005, Roza established her general store and liquor store business. Roza requests a loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer, soda, and water in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soft drinks, and water in bulk.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Ms. Korotoumou S. is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and their children, in Wayerma, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso. She started off earning money very early on because she did not attend school. After having run numerous businesses, she became specialized in selling local beverages (juices) and ice. In order to acquire a refrigerator, she decided to join the SORO YIRIWASO loan program discovered through a neighbor, who is a client of this institution. She is a on her first loan with this institution.

With this loan, she intends to buy a refrigerator in order to better serve her customer base that is growing and growing. She makes local beverages in her home, puts them in small plastic bags, and then cools them. She generally makes sales near primary schools in the city of Sikasso each day, except Saturdays and Sundays. Still, she makes sales at home to customers in the neighborhood. With this refrigerator, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, Ms. Korotoumou S. expects to come to her husband's aid because he only has a custodian's income.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Korotoumou S. est une femme mariée de 37 ans, mère de 7 enfants et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et leurs enfants à Wayerma I, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. Elle entama les activités économiques très tot en raison de sa non scolarisation. Après avoir mener maintes activités économiques, elle se spécialisa dans la vente de boissons locales (Jus) et de glace. Afin d’acquérir un réfrigerateur, elle décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de SORO YIRIWASO dont elle fut la connaissance à travers une voisine également une cliente de cette Institution.Elle est à son premier pret avecl’institution.

Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter un réfrigérateur afin de mieux servir sa clientèle.de plus en plus croissante. Elle fabrique les boissons locales chez elle, les met en sachet pour ensuiter les rafraichir. Elle vend généralement aux abord des écoles fondamentales de la ville de Sikasso tous les jours sauf Samedi et Dimanche. Cependant elle effectue des ventes à la maison à une clientèle voisine. Avec ce réfrigérateur elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 42 000 FCFA par mois. Grâce à ce bénéfice Madame Korotoumou S. compte venir en aide à son mari qui ne dispose que d’un revenu d’agent de gardiennage.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Zuhra's Group

texts.en:
Zuhra baji is the wife of Muhammad Amin and has been living in this city called Borewala, Pakistan for the last 14 years. She owns a two-room brick house. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband sells sugarcane syrup and has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Zuhra baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy another juicer machine to expand the business.

She is joined in her loan group by 3 other members. Nazia baji requests a loan to buy a shopper maker machine. Zahidan baji requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her land. Parveen baji requests a loan to buy more beams for her rental beams business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Jasmina Iveth

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Jasmina G. has worked for the last four years in the grocery store business offering all kinds of goods from groceries to household and personal products. She is the mother of two children who is obliged to support and provide for their studies.

Today, this woman’s urgent need is to buy products for her grocery store and for this reason she has gone to Cerpodel to obtain the necessary credit for the purchase of the aforementioned products and thus continue her business that requires investment for its respective development.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Jasmina G. se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de pulperia ofreciendo todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos personales y del hogar. Es madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene la obligacion de mantener y ademas de proporcionarles las necesidades para sus estudios.

Hoy en dia la necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es la urgencia de comprar los productos para su pulperia y por este motivo acude a Cerpodel para obtener el credito necesario para la compra de dichos productos y asi continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de inversion para su respectivo desarrollo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Zaida habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera, con dos hijos de 14 y16 años de edad, que están cursando la secundaria. El negocio de doña Zaida es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de frutas y verduras  y comida. Pues vende variedad de productos para salir adelante, comenzó  hace seis años en las ventas con dinero propio y por iniciativa de su mamá, sus dificultades han sido las ventas bajas y los ingresos para invertir más a su negocio. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para comprar productos para invertir en la compra de verduras y frutas. Sus planes son seguir creciendo en el negocio, mejorar su nivel de vida y poder ayudar a sus hijos que salgan a delante con los estudios para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zaida lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, is 39 years old, and is the single mother of two children who are 14 and16 years old and are in secondary school. Zaida’s business is the sale of new and used clothing as well as fruits, vegetables and food, so she sells a variety of products to be able to get ahead. She started her business six years ago with her own money and her mother’s initiative. Her difficulties have been low sales and having the income to invest more in her business. With the request that she is making, she will buy more products and invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. Her plans are to continue growing her business, improve her quality of life and be able to help her children advance with their studies so that they can be successful adults.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shazia Kala Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a daughter of K. M. and lives in a small area named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 20 years. She completed her education until 10th standard [grade]. She has one brother. Her brother is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and earns a profit. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her brother so that he is able to earn a better profit.

Shazia baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Lubna baji wants a loan to buy more wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Mrs. Loem H. lives in Srae Vong Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who can earn a little rice revenue because she owns a small rice field. Her husband, Mr. Ngov Seourng, is a rice wine maker in the local village. 

Although Mrs. Loem H. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well, so Mrs. Loem H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. 

Mrs. Loem H. is 39 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Né vers 1958 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur M. Samuel est marié et père de 3 enfants dont 0 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 170 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1958 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Samuel M. is married and the father of 3 children, none of whom attend school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the GM Senablo group of Glahouna.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the Ouémé River is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay laborers who are indispensible to them in getting their land sown.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Samuel M. has requested a loan of 170,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 2 hectares, growing the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Née en 1949 à Lomé, Mme D. Mawuena est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes à charge. Malgré son age un peu avancé, elle est toujours très forte et active. Son petit commerce de bonbon, chocolat, chewing-gum, amuse gueule n’arrive plus à lui procurer les ressources nécessaires pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner en marchandises et renforcer son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1949 in Lomé, Ms. Mawuena D. is married and a mother of five who has two others to support. Despite her rather advanced age, she is still very strong and active. Her small business selling candy, chocolate, chewing gum, and tasty treats is no longer able to bring in the necessary resources for supporting her family. For expanding her display of merchandise, getting supplies of goods, and boosting her sales figures, she is requesting financing. The profits will enable her to take better care of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mr. Savun T. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a duck breeder. His business is going well and he would like to expand. He requests a loan to buy more ducks to breed and duck food. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. 
Mr. Savun T. is 30 years old and the father of three children, one attending a local school and the other two are too young to work or study.  His wife, Mrs. T. Sinuon, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He's with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: To request a loan to buy more ducks to breed and duck food

loans.name: Foye

texts.en: Foye lives in largo State, Nigeria. She is engaged in the rental service of itms like chairs, tables, and canopies. Foye has been in this business since the year 1990 and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. Foye is 58 years old and married with 5 children. Foye is soliciting for a loan amount of N90, 000 to purchase more canopies, chairs, pots and tables to rent out. This will enable her to satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more canopies and chairs to rent

loans.name: Namirimu Joyce Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is 60 years of age. She is single and has three children. She owns a house with four rooms, where she lives with her four grandchildren. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is food. She sells charcoal to earn a living and she does this from home. She receives about ten customers a day. She has done this business for over four years now. Her main challenge in her business is transporting her charcoal from the village, especially during rainy seasons.

Joyce has been with MCDT for four years and has received eight loans so far. She has also worked with her group for four years. The reason she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted to get loans to increase her stock of charcoal. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her children. Her aspiration for the future is to build a bigger kiosk that can accommodate a larger stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
A. Islomjon is married and the father of three children. Islomjon received education up to secondary school level, but he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to continue. Now he works as a farmer.

Islomjon has a good work ethic and he has wholeheartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has become a man known for his determination and he serves as an example to other farmers. He has been growing wheat, corn, onions and tomatos for the past 4 years.

Islomjon is now seeking a loan of 2400 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops in the hopes of making prepayments for the upcoming season and to ensure a good harvest. In so doing, he can better meet the needs of his family and improve his work conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Juana María A. M.,  Sandra del Socorro J. y Eugenia M..

El grupo solidario Rojo está conformado por tres señoras, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, originarias del departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confíen en ellas, expresaron..
Son vecinas, de confianza, se conocen hace muchos años y son muy unidas. 
Doña Sandra del Socorro J. vende ropa de forma ambulante, ofrece camisas, pantalones y zapatos. No tiene hijos, ni pareja, ella sueña con poder estudiar en la secundaria y cuando tenga hijos tener un buen negocio para mantenerlos bien. Ella es la coordinadora del grupo porque es muy responsable, vive con su mamá a la que ella le ayuda económicamente.

Doña Eugenia M. vende zapatos, ropa y vende ambulante, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad , ella tiene un hijo pequeño para quien ella trabaja, su esposo trabaja en una empresa textilera y le ayuda con los gastos.

Doña Juana María A. tiene un pequeño taller en su casa donde elabora sandalias de mujer, tiene dos trabajadores y junto con su esposo manejan el negocio, el crédito le sirvió para comprar materiales como pega, cuero, hebillas, accesorios etc.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Shown above, from left to right: Juana María A. M., Sandra del Socorro J. and Eugenia M.. The Rojo (Red) Solidarity Group is composed of three women, all of them hardworking and of modest circumstances, who are from the Department of Masaya. They stated that they like working with ADIM because of the trust they have been shown. They are reliable neighbors who have known one another for many years and are very close. Doña Sandra del Socorro J. sells clothing door-to-door, offering shirts, pants and shoes. She doesn't have children or a partner. She dreams of being able to attend secondary school and when she has children, to have a good business in order to take good care of them. She is the coordinator of the group because she is very responsible. She lives with her mother who she helps support financially. Doña Eugenia M. is a street vendor, selling shoes and clothing. She has spent several years in this activity. She has a small son for whom she works. Her husband works in a textile business and she helps him with the expenses. Doña Juana María A. has a small workshop in her house where she makes women's sandals. She has two employees and together with her spouse they manage the business. The loan will be used to buy materials such as glue, leather, buckles, accessories, etc. This group is committed to being punctual with their payments, so as to be able to obtain loans with ADIM in the future. They are confident that with this loan they will be able to move ahead because it will increase their sales and thus also their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy adult's and children's clothing

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has been a coconut seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She belongs to A/Mola group loan (Group code 2039). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $115. Each day she works at her business for eight hours.

Asha is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more coconuts to sell. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Asha is 49 years old, married, and has given birth to six children, aged between 32 and 15.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita P. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 33 years old. Erlita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Erlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Erlita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to rent coconut land. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Erlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from investment to improve general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to rent coconut land

loans.name: Monarisa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Monarisa K. from Mwanza. She is married with one three-year-old child. Monarisa has been running a tailoring business since 2006. Client’s business is to make women clothes and resell them to her customers. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Monarisa currently earns about 130 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase another sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Monarisa thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 43 es una vecina muy querida en su barrio, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida. Todos los días camina por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, junto a su inseparable bolso de cosméticos busca clientes que desean comprar alguno de sus productos, ella es muy alegre y siempre atiende a las personas con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta a Maria de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre qué producto le dará mejores resultados, pero lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol visitando a sus clientes de casa en casa, lo que le causa mucho cansancio. María lleva 5 años en esta actividad y espera hacer crecer su negocio y poder tener una tienda de cosméticos, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos y poco a poco acercarse más a sus metas. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy responsable. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, is much loved in her neighborhood. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She has a great desire to get ahead in life. Every day she walks the streets of the city of Juliaca, together with her inseparable cosmetics bag, looking for customers who want to buy some of her products. She is very happy, and she always waits on people with a smile on her lips. What Maria likes most about her work is advising her customers about which product will give them the best results. The most difficult is having to walk all day under the cruel sun while she goes door to door visiting her customers. This makes her very tired. María has been doing this for five years. She hopes to expand her business and be able to have a cosmetics store in order to improve her earnings. Little by little she gets closer to her goals. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her first payments, and she expects to do the same now, too. In her Community Bank she is well liked by the rest of her colleagues because she is very responsible. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy more beauty products to be able to offer her customers greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a member of the Tuwepamoja borrower group. She is a 32-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of four children aged 13, 11, 7 and 2 years.
 
Fatma started her own business selling charcoal two years ago. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tsh.

This is Fatma’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 500,000 TZS in order to buy more charcoal to sell. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Fatma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 54 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one son and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband and to be able to provide for the family. Beatrice lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. She sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. Beatrice buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for eight years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is thirty-one years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, a daughter and three sons. All are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment Wiawso, a commercial town in the Western Region. 

As a single parent, she needs to work hard to provide for her family. Felicia sells rice and stew in her locality. She prepares the food in her house and sells by the roadside. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients in Kumasi at affordable prices. Felicia has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells drinks, provisions and wine. She has been in this business for long. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Kemi is 42 years old and married with 4 children. Kemi hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Nacy Yola

texts.es:
La señora  Yola es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, tiene 03  hijos, vive en el Sector Central, estudio educación secundaria incompleta (3er grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 ciclos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para venderlo en carne, o también los vende vivos en las ferias de la semana.

Su mayor deseo es poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  la puntualidad y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos wishes to improve his income. He is 55 years old and a rice farmer. He resides in a town in Agusan Del Sur. Rice is one of the major agricultural crops in his town. 

Carlos shared that his rice crops are still young and need fertilizers and proper caring. He requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, a Kiva partner. From this loan, he will buy the farm supplies he needs for his farm. Hopefully, he will have better income on his harvest.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma E. is from the village of Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Elma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $153 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Elma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kouta

texts.fr: Kouta C. est une femme de 42 ans elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et demi et a 13 expériences avec le crédit. Avec son prêt elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouta C., aged 42, is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of a village bank for six and a half years and received 13 loans. She will use her loan to produce and sell peanut butter. The profit from this activity will enable her to contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Ninda

texts.en:
If you have survived hardship in your life, you would never want your loved ones to experience the same difficulties if it were within your power to save them from such an experience. At 61 years old, Ninda E. lives in Purok Paraiso, a neighborhood of Barangay Taloc in Bago City, located in Negros Occidental Province on the Western Visayas islands. She and her husband, Antonio, are still working hard to improve the quality of their family’s life.

Antonio works as a rice farm laborer. This was his source of income when he and Ninda were married and started their family. Back then with four young children, they found themselves in dire straits living well below the poverty line, sometimes having no food to feed their children. It was then that Ninda became determined to raise her children's quality of life by earning her own income to help her husband support their family.

In 2000, she decided to try her luck and applied to join NWTF Project Dungganon so that she could get good business advice and guidance if she were accepted as a member. She passed all the necessary requirements, and with her first loan she built a sari-sari (general store) adjacent to their house. Once she had saved up enough, she widened the variety of goods she sold in her store. With the help of her income from her general store, Ninda's children were able to go to school and finish their college education. Presently NInda earns a minimum monthly income of 3,750 PHP.

Now Ninda is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her general store. Her previous loan, also 19,500 PHP, was fully utilized as additional working capital for her general store. She paid her installments every week and fully paid off the loan within its term.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Consuela

texts.es:
Consuela, de 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijas: Martha de 12, Maritza de 9 y Yudith de 5, a quienes desea dar un buen futuro.

Junto a su inseparable triciclo trabaja todas las mañanas desde muy temprano vendiendo deliciosas frutas por la calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que la fruta que vende es muy fresca y sabrosa.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así hacer más amena la venta, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol.
Para más adelante, desea juntar el dinero necesario para alquilar un pequeño puesto donde pueda vender sus frutas con mayor comodidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Consuela con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, ya que es la socia más joven y alegre. Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fruta para implementar mejor su carretilla.
texts.en:
Consuela is 30 years old and is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She lives in one of her relatives along with her three daughters: Martha, age 12; Maritza age 9; and Yudith age 5; all of whom she wishes to give a good future. Along with her inseparable tricycle she works from the early morning hours selling delicious fruit on the Juliaca city streets. She has many customers as the fruit she sells is very fresh and flavorful. What she likes about her work is conversing with her customers and in this way increasing her sales. She has been selling fruit for 6 years and the most difficult thing about her work is having to walk all day beneath the inclement sun. This is Consuela’s fourth loan with MFP and she feels very confident in being able to pay her payments on time, as she doesn’t want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she very loved, as she is the youngest member and happy. With 1600 soles she seeks she will buy more fruit to better stock her cart.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit for her fruit cart

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia tiene 65 años de edad es casada  tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cuando ella empezó a vender fue por la razón de que su esposo estuvo con problemas de salud, por lo que tomo la iniciativa de vender ropa porque no tenía el ingreso suficiente para proporcionarle a su familia la ayuda necesaria, pero ella inicio ahorrando muy pocas cantidades de ganancias por lo que fue así que aumentando su inventario, ella recorría muchos lugares en busca de obtener nuevos clientes, por lo que aprendió a obtener experiencia para interactuar con sus clientes. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadería ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para tener una fuente ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Adilia is 65 years old, married, and has 2 children in her care. She sells clothing. She started the business because her husband was having health problems, so she took the initiative to sell clothing because she did not have enough income to support her family. She started saving very small amounts of her earnings, and in this way she increased her inventory. She went to many places in search of new customers; through this experience she learned how to interact with her customers. Her loan will be used to purchase merchandise, since she currently has many orders. Her goal is to continue investing in her business in order to have a regular source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to buy clothing)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Nilba

texts.es:
Nilba es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de un año de edad en el sector Colector del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace seis años, tiene actualmente seis vacas de las cuales cuatro están produciendo leche, la leche que producen la vende a una empresa acopiadora que visita el lugar y que se las compra a 0.90 céntimos el litro. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como taxista no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente, Nilba siembra forraje para sus animales en una pequeña extensión de terreno cercana al área donde vive. Ella desea comprar una nueva vaca que le permita aumentar su producción y así poder seguir sacando adelante a su familia, durante algunos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero, pero lo que actualmente tiene no es suficiente para lograr su objetivo. Por eso se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Nilba es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de lo que hace. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la fotografía aparece junto a su hijo mostrandonos la leche que sus vacas han producido durante el dia y que espera ser recogida.
texts.en:
Nilba is a 27 year old mother who lives with her husband and one year old son in the area of Colector in the District of San José, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Nilba has been raising cattle for six years. Of the six cows that she currently owns, four are producing milk. She sells the milk to a collection business that comes to her farm and purchases the milk for 0.90 PEN per liter. Nilba’s milk business has been a great help in supporting her family. Her husband works as a taxi driver and his earnings are not enough to cover the family expenses.

In addition, Nilba grows fodder for her animals in a small plot of land near her home. She wants to buy another cow so that she can increase her milk production and continue to move her family forward. Nilba has been setting aside money for a few months, but she still does not have money to carry out her objective. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest wish is to give her child a better life. Nilba is a hardworking woman who enjoys what she does. She has previously worked with our Institution and demonstrated that she is a timely and responsible client when it comes to making her payments. Nilda appears in the photograph with her son and is showing us the milk that her cows have produced and is waiting to be collected.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
The smiling man appearing in the picture above, Mr. S., age 30, resides in a village located near Phnom Penh city. He currently owns a truck that he uses to provide transport service for a profit. He has a partner in his wife who stays at home to do housework. 

This couple married a few years ago, but they do not have a child yet and they plan to have a child next year. From the business, S. is able to generate an average of US$ 10 per day to cover family expenses. Recently his truck’s motor often has broken down during the process and his income has also been affected. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to be used to hire a mechanic to mend his broken down truck.

loans.use: To hire a mechanic to mend his broken-down truck

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old farmer and married father of two young children, aged seven and ten. He has been farming a mixed crop for the last ten years and also runs a small shop. He earns income selling stones and the cereals produced on his farm. The greatest challenge to his business ventures is a lack of capital to expand. 

John has requested his first loan of 45,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to begin poultry farming. With this new venture, he will be able to meet demand for eggs within the local area. In the future, he would also like to expand into dairy farming and open an Agrovet shop. John commented that, "Juhudi Kilimo is supporting more low-income farmers than other microfinance institutions" and that because of their support he will be able to diversify his business.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Sie Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 people from Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Thy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Thy S. is a mother of four children, three of whom attend a local public schoO. and the other of whom is too young to work or study. She and her husband, Mr. Sok Chuon, are farmers who own a three-hectare piece of land to grow crops for sale to support their family. They work hard, but still do not earn sufficient income because their field is far from an irrigation system, has infertile soil, and contains a lot of insects. Therefore, in order to improve their vegetable production, Mrs. Thy S. has decided to apply for a loan to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Ainea

texts.en:
Ainea Angweke L. is 34 years old, married and has three children, whom he hopes to give the highest level of education. His business is located in Kakamega. He has been selling spades, padlocks, slashers, trowels and other tools to the local people. He has been doing this business for ten years now. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Ainea is using his loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more hardware equipment to expand his business. He hopes to be a big businessman and catch a big target market. He is very hardworking, patient and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy spades, slashers and  padlocks

loans.name: Mrs. Chroeb Pen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Thnal Louk village in TaK. province make up a village bank loan group. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future.

 Mrs. Chroeb P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a coffee seller in the local village and aside from this, she is a pig breeder too. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Orang, is a farmer who owns a more than two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family.
