Their problem is that their field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Chroeb P. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is attending local public school, and the youngest one is only one year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante con especialidad en comida china, en un local alquilado ubicado en la alameda del cementerio, lugar con mucha afluencia de personas, Martha cuenta que inicio su negocio con una carpa y se ubicaban en la calle, luego paso a asociarse con otra persona y abrieron un local, actualmente tienen un negocio mas grande  que le generará mas ingresos, la atención es por las noches hasta la madrugada.
Martha es socia del banco Comunal Los Claveles y lo que le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y el incentivo al ahorro, Martha con sus ahorros y prestamos logro construir su casa y ahora esta realizando los acabados de su casa, Martha solicita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido para el tarrajeo de su casa y comprara cemento.
Los sueños de Martha son comprar su carro y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha and her husband have a restaurant specializing in Chinese food, which operates from a rented location along an avenue that is next to a cemetery, a place where many people gather. She started her business out a tent located on the street, but she later partnered with another person and opened her restaurant. Her business is now larger and generates more income. She serves customers starting at night until dawn.

Martha is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations) and likes that the loans are easy to work with and that she has the incentive to save. She used her savings and loans to build a house and now she is completing the finishing touches. Martha is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN so that she can whitewash her house and buy cement.

Martha dreams of buying a car and seeing her son finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Whitewash her house & purchase cement

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Merlyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing trisikad  (pedicab) services to local community members. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: C2328 Abahujumutima Group

texts.en:
Rambert is 40 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 12. In this family, only Rambert works and so he has to work hard so that he provides everything necessary for his family.

Rambert is a businessman selling fruit and cakes and this business is fruitful for him, he said. Rambert is also the leader of this group which is called Abahujumutima. The group contains five women and one man; most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs.

Rambert and his group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Marjourie

texts.en: Marjourie S. is from the village of Motibot. She is 37 years old and is single. Marjourie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marjourie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marjourie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Visión De Fe Group

texts.es: La señora Haydee N. L. es socia del banco Mujeres Chiumaltenango tiene 3 años de trabajar con fape la señora es muy trabajadora tiene 40 Años de edad tiene 4 hijos y su esposo la apoya mucho en su negocio ella tiene venta de tortillas y de chiles reyenos desde que inicio su credito en fape tiene una persona quien la ayuda para poder sacar sus pedido. La señora Elicia tiene 38 Años ella tiene su negocio ambulante y tiene 30 gallinas ponedoras. La Socia Eulalia tiene 30 Años ella se dedica a la elavoracion de ropa de bebe y a vender en diferente lugares tiene maquinas para poder elavorar los trajes anterior mente solo vendia en el mercado de Chimaltenango y Ahora ya se ha extendido en el departamento
texts.en:
Mrs. Haydee N. L. is a member of the Mujeres Chimaltenago bank and has worked with FAPE for the past 3 years. She is a hardworking 40 year old, has 4 children, and her husband is a big support for her in her business. She sells tortillas and stuffed chile peppers. Since she started working with FAPE she has had someone who helps her get her orders out. Mrs. Wlicia is 38, and she is a street vendor and has 30 laying hens. Member Eulalia is 30 and she works making baby clothing and sells them in different locations. She has sewing machines now to help her make the clothing. Before she only sold in the Chimaltenango market and now she is working throughout the Department.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maiz para la tortillería, gallinas, y materias primas para la ropa

loans.name: Eng Kong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng K., 49, is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use their portions to support different purposes.

Eng is a widow with five children. Two are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is a laborer, while the others are students in the local public school. Eng is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate peanuts for a living.

Eng’s house is now old and uncomfortable, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy timber and construction supplies to fix her house up.

loans.use: To buy timber and construction supplies to fix her house up

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay N. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three young children in Takeo province. Since 2004, she has been selling vegetables at the local market to earn a profit, typically making $3 USD per day. Her husband, pictured here, makes and sells piggy banks. On average, he earns $2 USD per day. Hay N. is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport the piggy banks to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport goods to market

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
S. Fotima is 47 years old. Together with her husband they have three children. Fotima sells DVD and CD products. She orders the delivery of the disks from Russia and tries to have all the new movies with popular actors and concerts with popular singers in stock. The business is successful in generating the main income for her family. Today Fotima requests 8,000 Somoni for the purchase of more DVDs and CDs for selling. Fotima thanks all who support her and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs and CDs for resale

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong M., 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. The area is known for pre-Angkorean temples. M. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. One of her children is employed, earning an income of about USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Every month the family spends USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses.  

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

[M.'s husband appears in the photograph because M. was not available.]

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Sengemaa

texts.en:
Sengemaa D. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Arhangai province of Mongolia. The family all lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her youngest son attends high school. Her two children raise their livestock in the countryside. 

Sengemaa operates a mobile dairy trading business, in which the family prepares dairy products to sell in the local market. She started this business in 2008, and has built a stable operation. Today, her working capital has reached 500,000 MNT. In the years of running her business, Sengemaa has gained a reputation among her customers as a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. She purchases dairy products from wholesale traders and sells back at the local markets. With her earnings, she plans to prepare a new home for her son who will live on his own soon. Sengemaa needs more funds to purchase a large amount of dairy products in order to sell for the upcoming winter. Sengemaa is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies for resale

loans.name: Esther Roman

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito D. Azángaro, provincia D. Azángaro, y departamento D. Puno, tiene 43 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 06 hijos, realizó estudios D. educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial  fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. carne.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar ovejas para su engorD. y venderlas en carne.

Su sueño para es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las charlas y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the community bank "Azangarinas Valientes", located in the Azángaro district in the province of Azángaro and department of Puno.  She is 43 years old, married, and has six children.  She finished her schooling after elementary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her business that sells meat.

She is asking for a new loan of 800 nuevos soles to purchase sheep to raise and sell.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business.  The things she likes best about her community bank are the lectures and sporting events.

loans.use: Purchase sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 30-year-old married man. He sells scrap metals so as to earn a living. Besides that, he is a mechanic. He has been able to grow his business through Faulu Kenya because he has been taught how to manage a business. He hopes to expand his business and buy a piece of land in the future.  

He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy scrap metals and enlarge his store where he stores the metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals and enlarge his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy products and other products

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón R. hace unos días le dieron  su casa de Infonavit  pero cuando le dieron la casa al Sr. Ramón la casa tenia unos desperfectos el cual el Sr. Ramón esta reparando, el solicita el préstamo para poder impermeabilizar su casa ya que se le germina el agua para adentro, el es una persona divorciada y vive solo, trabaja casi todo el día, es una persona muy perseverante  y se preocupa por salir adelante, el quiere en un futuro hacer su casa a su gusto.
texts.en: Ramón R. was given his house by Infonavit a few days ago (Infonavit is a government program that provides low-cost mortgages to working families so they can buy small starter homes).  However, when they gave him his house, it had some damage which Ramón is working to repair.  He is requesting this loan so that he can waterproof his house because water comes in.   Ramón is divorced and lives alone.  He works almost all day long.  He is a very persevering person and looks after getting himself ahead in life.  In the future, he would like to make his house his home.

loans.use: To waterproof his house

loans.name: Parsapiyio Ole

texts.en:
Parsapiyio Ole K. is 61 years old. He is married and supports sixteen people in the family.

Parsapiyio has been a farmer for twenty years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learnt about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy seed wheat and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, so that he can increase his wheat production and educate his children.

In the future he wants to practice large-scale farming, and later, when the business is stable, he also plans to buy a bigger piece of land where he can build a permanent home and settle his family. Parsapiyio is a hardworking man who is capable of achieving more if supported financially

loans.use: To buy seed wheat and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dolores Aleyda

texts.es:
Dolores madre soltera, mujer emprendedora de profesión maestra y tiene ventas de fritanga en su casa, su planes es que su hijo se prepare. Requiere de mejoras en su vivienda ya que la seguridad es de prioridad. Ha tenido dificultades para lograr que la infraestructura de su casa este completamente. Con el préstamo será invertido en compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, laminas de zinc, tabla, alambre de amarre. Para la construcción de un cuarto, cambio de zinc y reforzar las paredes.
Agradece a la institución por fomentar el desarrollo de oportunidades para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores is a single mother.  She’s an enterprising woman who is a teacher by profession.  She also sells fast food from home.  Her plan is that her son prepares himself.

Her home is in need of some repairs because safety is a priority.  She has had some difficulty in completing her house’s infrastructure.

The loan will be invested in buying building materials and supplies:  cement, iron rods, zinc metal sheeting, lumber and fastening wire to build a room, replace the zinc metal and strengthen walls.

She thanks the institution for encouraging development of opportunities to improve living standards.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Nola Green Transportation, LLC is a full-time food delivery service.  Erica S., owner of Nola Green Transportation, manages food delivery for restaurants that do not have the delivery volume to merit having their own drivers.  By using NGT, restaurants can offer delivery service to their clients without losing the time it takes to deliver.  

Originally a Texas native, Erica moved to New Orleans after high school to attend Tulane University.  Unable to obtain sufficient financial aid for her studies, she went back to working full-time at a restaurant – something she had been doing since she was 14.  She says she first had the idea of NGT when she began noticing the time that was lost when restaurant staff had to take off to deliver an order.

Erica has rolling two-month contracts with restaurants, meaning the contracts automatically renew unless the restaurant decides to opt out.  Some current clients include Mexican, Moroccan, Middle-Eastern, Spanish and Cajun restaurants.  Erica’s drivers pick up the food from the restaurants and deliver it to the customers.  Right now, Erica has two drivers and will soon hire a third.

Erica is using this loan for operating capital, payment of accumulated debts, and for two months of office rent.  She always needs cash on hand because her drivers are sub-contractors (they buy the food from the restaurants and then collect payment from the customers).  At the end of the day, Erica reimburses her drivers for the money they pay the restaurants.  When Erica’s customers pay with credit cards, Erica does not receive payment from the credit card companies for two days.  This loan gives Erica the needed cushion to pay her drivers until she receives payment from the credit card companies.

Right now, Erica consistently works 13- and 14-hour days.  Though these are long hours, she likes owning her own business because of the freedom it provides her.  She recommends other business owners be realistic when setting goals – things take three times longer than you think they should.  With the added hassle of billing through credit card companies, she also recommends dealing in cash whenever possible.

Erica opened Nola Green Transportation, LLC in September, 2010.  She says NGT’s biggest success so far is that it became profitable within the first four months of opening.  Her 5 year plan for the business is to expand to all of New Orleans, which will require opening an additional five offices, each with its own operational setup, throughout the city.  Erica is 22 years old.

loans.use: For operating capital and to pay for accumulated debts and two months rent

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Siemana, préfecture de Barouéli ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’argile blanche, de galette et d’articles divers.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’argile blanche, des céréales des articles de boutique.                                                                         
DJENEBA T. compte acheter deux sacs de mil et du beurre de karité pour la préparation des galettes. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en: The women in the Djekafo group are all married and on average are 43 years old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Siemana, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through community, kinship and friendship ties. They sell white clay, galettes (a cake similar to a pancake or crepe) and other items. The women in the Djekafo group are on their sixth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy white clay, grains, and boutique items.  Djeneba T. plans to buy shea butter and two bags of millet for making galettes. She sells her products daily from her home and at the market, in cash and on credit to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000F CFA which will be used to pay the loan installments and to make contributions to social ceremonies.  The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making galettes.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina T. is from the village of Poblacion in Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 63 years old. Carolina is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business venture offering vehicle repair and welding services to the local community. Her husband works as the repairman. Caroline also makes and sells sausage, or chorizzo. She has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials that were needed to expand her business. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for her business and for working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Carolina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for her business and for working capital.

loans.name: Edem  Ayoko

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ayoko a 25 ans. Elle habite quartier Adakpamé à Lomé.  Elle est couturière de profession mais elle a associé la vente de pagnes et articles de mercerie. Elle a commencé en 2007 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend dans son atelier à Adakpamé à côté de la station Oando. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes et un lot d’articles de mercerie. Mais présentement, elle n’a pas le stock de pagnes et d’articles de mercerie.
texts.en: Ayoko is 25 years old. She lives in Adakpamé, a neighborhood of Lomé. She is a trained seamstress and she has included the sale of fabrics and haberdashery in her business. She began her activity in 2007 and she purchases her products at the main market in Lomé. She works and sell her products in her workshop in Adakpamé, next to Oando Station. She is requesting a loan to buy twenty fabric pieces and some haberdashery, as she is running out of stock.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and haberdashery

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 3,800 PHP through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a safe light source at night and also be able to charge the cellphone that she uses. Luzvisminda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a Solar Lamp

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Seab C. is 36 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province. She is married and has three children who are single. They still live with Seab C.. Her husband’s name is Lach Mach, and he is a causal construction worker as well as a domestic fisherman.

She earns a living raising pigs in a cage behind her house. She raises pigs for breeding and slaughter and often sells to people who come to buy in bulk at her house.  

Seab C. has applied for a $500 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Angamos Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. MariceL. tiene 49 años  es casada sus 03 hijos viven con elL.  y le hace muy feliz poder  ayudar a su familia  su trabajo le permite cubrir los gastos D. vestimenta y alimentación D. esa manera ayuda a su esposo que también trabaja,  MariceL. empezó con L. venta D. cosméticos los ofrecía mediante catálogos le iba bien pero le dejaba poca ganancia, fue una amiga quien le dio L. idea D. vender tintes para cabello un producto con mucha demanda  así empezó ofreciendo este producto a distintos negocios D. peluquerías y a sus mismas clientas que le compraban los productos D. belleza ahora le muy bien en su negocio y lo que mas ansia es  tener un lugar estable donD. vender directamente para no tener que caminar en las calles, con su préstamo abastecerá su negocio comprando tintes y joyas para el día D. las madres que es una fecha muy especial donD. L. venta es buena, elL. acaba D. ser nombrada L. nueva presidenta del grupo “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS D. ANGAMOS” este grupo esta conformado por  07 socias.
  
 * MariceL. es L. 4ta D. L. foto esta con polo negro.
texts.en:
Señora MariceL. is 49 years old, married and has 3 children who live with her.  It makes her very happy to be able to help her family.  Her job allows her to cover food and clothing costs.  This way she is able to help her husband who also works.  

MariceL. started with selling cosmetics through catalogs and this went well, but she didn't earn much money.  A friend gave her the idea to sell hair dyes, a product that is in high demand.  She started selling to different hair salons and to her same customers that bought her beauty products.  Now the business is going very well and what she wants most is to have a fixed location where she can sell directly without having to walk from place to place.  She will use the loan to buy dyes and jewelry for Mother's Day which is a special day when sales are high.  

MariceL. was just named the new president of the group "Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Angamos".  This group is maD. up of 7 members.

*MariceL. is the 4th in the photo with the black shirt.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes and jewelry.

loans.name: Handdorj

texts.en:
Handdorj, 70, lives with his wife and younger daughter in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His three children are grown up and live separately, but Handdorj always helps them to make their lives better. Because he manages a shoe repair business near a crowded and busy bus stop, he has many customers and earns sufficient money. He started his business in 2005 and is planning to continue it for the foreseeable future.

A responsible man who says, "If my children are happy with their lives, I will be happy too," Handdorj is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car for his son to start a taxi service.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Las Dedicadas Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS DEDICADAS", PORQUE ES UN GRUPO DE MUJERESDEDICADAS EN CUERPO Y ALMA A SU TRABOJO Y FAMILIA PARA PROGRESAR. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MÉXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 7 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA REBECA ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LAS DEDICADAS, ELLA TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 16 AÑOS QUE ESTUDIA LA PREPARATORIA. LA SEÑORA REBECA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE PAN DE DULCE DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS. SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR HARINA, AZUCAR Y ALGUNOS UTENCILIOS QUE NECESITA. CON ESTA INVERCION QUE TENDRA SU NEGOCIO PIENSA AUMENTAR SIGNIFICATIVAMENTE SUS GANANCIAS, CON LAS CUALES ESPERA COMPRAR UN HORNO, ESTO LE PERMITIRA PRODUCIR PAN EN CANTIDADES MAYORES. CON LAS GANANCIAS OBTENIDAS PINSA PODER PAGAR LA UNIVERSIDAD PARA SU HIJO Y QUE ASI TENGA UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group is called "LAS DEDICADAS", because it is a group of women totally dedicated in body and soul to their work and families in order to get ahead.  The group is located in the state of México and comprised of seven members. 

Mrs. Rebeca, 56, has a secondary education.  She is married and has a 16-year-old son in high school.  Rebeca has been in the pastry business for two years.  She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar and needed utensils.  With this investment she hopes to increase her earnings significantly so she can buy an oven and produce a larger volume of pastry.  She also hopes to be able to pay for her son's university costs to give him a better future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and utensils to make pastry.

loans.name: Fatima Maritza

texts.es: La señora Fátima tiene su cabina de teléfonos y realiza venta de celulares y tarjetas por mayor y menor en la zona de villa Fátima. Fue integrante del banco de emprendimiento buenas emprendedoras que ya finalizaron su crédito y no renovaron por falta de personas responsables la señora Fátima solicito el crédito de manera individual,  vive con su esposo y con su hijo en la zona 3 de mayo,  el crédito esta destinado a la compra de tarjetas pre pago por mayor para carga de celulares y compra de celulares por mayor de distintos modelos, es una persona joven amable con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fátima has a telephone booth and sells cell phones and phone cards wholesale and retail in Villa Fátima district.  She was previously a member of the 'Buenas Emprendedoras' community bank.  This group paid back their loan but did not request a new one as there weren't enough responsible people.  For this reason, Fátima has requested an individual loan.  She lives with her husband and son in 3 de Mayo district.  She will use her loan to buy pre-paid phone cards for cell phones wholesale.  She will also buy different cell phone models.  She is a kind young person who has a desire to improve herself.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and cell phones wholesale

loans.name: Koukin Yaare Group

texts.fr:
Mme Alizeta est responsable du groupe KOUKIN YAARE. Elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moin âgé a 13ans.1 va à l’école et elle a 4 personne a sa charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 30ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un demi Ball de fils de tisse et 1kg de teinture toute couleur confondue.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle économise et prend soin de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir un e grande commerçante en gros de pagnes tissés, assurer la scolarité de son enfant et construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alizeta is the leader of the Koukin Yaare group. She is a widow and a mother of four children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest 13 years old. One goes to school. Four people depend on her.

She has been a weaver for 30 years. Mrs. Alizeta gets her supplies from the market in the city's sector 10. Her clients are men and women.

She wants to purchase half a ball of weaving yarns and one kilo of various colors of dyes.

With her profits, she is saving and taking care of her children. Her ambition is to become a major wholesaler of weaved fabrics, to ensure that her child goes to school, and to get her house built.

loans.use: to purchase half a ball of weaving yarns and one kilo of various colors of dyes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA AMISTAD D. OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Ollantaytambo, Provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia; la socia tiene 56 años; la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, los hijos D. la socia son todos independientes, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un puesto D. venta D. frutas al por menor, lo que quiere decir que la socia venD. por unidades todos tipo D. frutas como, plátanos, manzanas, mandarinas, duraznos, uvas y todas las frutas D. la estación; La socia desea poder invertir el crédito en la compra D. frutas por cajas para la venta, la socia desea el crédito para comprar por cajas plátanos, uvas, manzanas, papaya. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas al por mayor y menor.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LA AMISTAD D. OLLANTAYTAMBO" which is in the district of Ollantaytambo, in Urubamba Province, department of Cusco.

She is 56, married and has five children, who are all independent.  She has a retail business and sells from her stand all types of fruit such as bananas, apples, tangerines, peaches, grapes and seasonal fruit.  She wants to use the loan to buy crates of bananas, grapes, apples and papaya wholesale.

She is very content and grateful for the support she is receiving and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit wholesale for retail sales.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma owns and manages a general store in their bario (village). She is 56 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works on their farm planting rice and vegetables for their food consumption and to sell. She is doing her best to make further improvement in her store to help provide the needs of her family. 

She has been in the retail business for almost 10 years now earning an average net income of PHP 9,000 each month. She uses the income for their food needs, clothing and allowances of her children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sugar, junk foods, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell in her store situated in the bario.

loans.use: to buy sugar, junk foods, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married with one child. She is 44 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Catherine sells used clothing to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 1,800 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase more bundles of used clothing. Catherine has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Catherine hopes to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothing

loans.name: 20 De Julio Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción, 15 vecinas y amigas se unieron con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos para sus hogares. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día luchan por el sustento de sus hogares. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y por sobre todo muy emprendedoras. El mayor objetivo de ellas es darle a sus familias una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La señora Marcela se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una tienda de ropas donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes toda la variedad de prendas que posee. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compran de ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que ha recibido mucha demanda de ese tipo de prendas y le gustaría cumplir con sus clientes. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
In the city of Asunción, there are 15 lady friends and neighbors who got together to generate more income for their homes.  They are head-of-household women who struggle daily to provide for their families.  They define themselves as working, fighting women who are very enterprising.  Their main goal is to give their families a dignified, proper life, without being deprived of things like they were.

Mrs. Marcela sells all types of clothing and, thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead and improve her family's living conditions.  One of her dreams is to have her own clothing store one day where she can offer a wide variety of garments to her customers.  She claims to have a defined selection of customers who always buy from her.

She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing since she has received many orders for this kind of apparel and she wants to be able to fill the orders.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy winter  for resale.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

María desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar la compra de más animales y realizar unos arreglos a su corral, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.  María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su hija tenga lo mejor para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
María is a 39-year-old mother who lives with her daughter in her own home.  She lacks basic services, and is located in the rural area of the Túcume district, in the Lambayeque department.  This region is characterized by its farming and stock raising.

For 5 years, María been raising and selling goats.  The corral is located behind her house, and both are suitable and spacious.  She gives them balanced feed and natural grasses, so that her animals enjoy optimum growth, to thus offer them in the area’s various markets, and derive earnings sufficient to cover her daily household expenses.

She has requested a 1,500-sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa, to purchase additional animals and make some repairs to their pen.  With income from her sales, she can cover the loan and improve her daughter’s standard of living.  María is a hard-working person, very reliable, and the only thing she wants is for her daughter to have the best, in order to get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy more animales and make improvements to their pen.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 24 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province in Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays at home.

Odgerel started working in 2008 at Tsahiur Mandal LLC as a carpenter. His profession is in high demand from April to October but in low demand from December to March. Besides being a carpenter, he also drives a taxi. He earns 200,000 MNT per month from his taxi service.

Odgerel is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to make the payment on his taxi. He wants to become an independent carpenter with the income from his taxi service and Tsahiur Mandal salary. He is a diligent man who asserts, "I want to open my own private business very much."

loans.use: to make the payment on his taxi.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a married man. His wife runs a beauty salon, and they have six children aged between 4 and 22 years whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. He runs a milk sales business at an estate in Nairobi. He has been doing this business for two years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his fridge and buy more milk for selling to his customers. He hopes to grow his business and a open a milk depot in the future. He also sees himself owning a house. He describes himself as honest, determined and focused.

loans.use: To repair his fridge and buy more milk.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline used her previous loan of 70,000 KES to buy computers. These additional computers have enabled her to serve her customers more efficiently in printing and photocopying, hence attracting more customers. Pauline has requested another loan of 70,000 KES to buy stationery such as printing paper.

loans.use: To buy stationery such as printing paper

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He earns a living by selling electronics.  He has been in this business for eleven years and employs two people.  He also runs a cafeteria to earn extra income for his family.  Previously, he was farming.

Johnstone has been able to expand his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  With 50,000 Kenya shillings, he will buy speakers and amplifiers.

loans.use: to buy speakers and amplifiers.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the transport business for one year. He was formerly working as a mechanic. His hardships are high fuel, high transport costs and increased capital. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goal is expanding his business to new markets. Frank needs the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Chanthol, 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorian sites. Chanthol is a silk weaver and her husband is a recycler. This couple work so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family's expenses. Chanthol is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase raw silk to produce silk products for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products for sale

loans.name: Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Tambudzai is 55 years old. She is married and does not have any children. She has two dependants who live with her.

She sells a range of products from a stall in the local market. These include clothes, shoes, bags, vegetables and tomatoes. She has been in business for 15 years and is doing well. She faces a challenge that sometimes business is slow. In the next 5 years she would like to build her own shop. With the profits from the business she will be able to buy food for the two children who live with her.

loans.use: to buy bags, clothes and vegetables.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
La Sra. Lita es un persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y bolsas plásticas en el mercado. Ella es casada con cuatro hijos pero solo uno esta a su cargo.
Lita trabaja de lunes a domingos en el mercado con una hija.
Visita oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar ropa y termos.
 A gradece a ceprodel por los prestamos brindados ya que ahora su negocio cuenta con mayor inventario para competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Señora Lita is a hardworking person who makes her living selling clothing and plastic bags in the marketplace. She is married with four children, but only one of them is a dependent. 

Lita works seven days a week in the marketplace with one of her daughters.

She appreciates CEPRODEL for the loans they have provided her. Now her business has greater inventory in order and can be more competitive.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and Thermoses.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad, el mismo es soltero vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Luque. El nos comenta que tiene una despensa hace 6 años, gracias a los años que lleva en el negocio ya cuenta con muy buena clientela, sus productos los compra del mercado de Luque.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que trabaja diariamente de sol a sol para poder darle a su familia lo mejor. El quiere darle una buena vejez a sus padres y de alguna forma retribuirles todo lo que invirtieron en el.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos básicos como ser azúcar, yerba, fideos, arroz, y productos enlatados lo cual le servirá para poder abastecer su negocio, pues son los productos que más salida tienen.
Dicho prestamo le dara un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus padres.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo is a return client of this institution. He is single and lives with his parents in the city of Luque. He tells us that he has had a store for six years. Thanks to the years he has spent running this business, he now has a very good customer base. He buys his products in the Luque market.
He is a very hard-working person. He works every day from sunrise to sunset in order to give his family the best. He wants to take care of his parents in their old age, in order to pay them back in some way for all they have done for him.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of basic food goods such as sugar, mate, rice, and canned goods. This will help him to stock his business, since these items are his best sellers.
This loan will give his business a better profit margin, helping him to increase his living standards and those of his parents.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mate, pasta, and canned goods.

loans.name: Donny Magochar Group

texts.en:
Donny is 30 years old. She is a single mother with 2 children ages 7 and 3 years old. Only one child is going to school. She does not have any other dependents she stays with.

She is in the business of selling cooked sausages to people in her community. She has been in this business for 3 years and she operates her business from Rujeko in Masvingo. She has requested a loan of $150.00 to buy sausages, cooking oil and a few dollars to fill her cooking gas stove. With the income from this loan Donny will be able save for her children's future. She buys her products from Harare. The challenges she faces include proper shelter to do her business from, because during the rain season the place becomes very muddy and during summer season the place becomes very hot . She is planning to get a stall from the authority to operate in a much better place during any time of the year.

loans.use: to buy sausages and cooking oil and fill her gas stove

loans.name: Jipargul

texts.ru: Жыпаргул родилась на юге Кыргызстана, в простой семье фермера и с детства помогала родителям по хозяйству. Жыпаргул вышла замуж в 19 лет и в 1989, 1990 и 1993 годах родила двух дочерей и сына. В 1994 года, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Жыпаргул начала перепродавать рис на рынке г. Ош (юг страны).Через 2 года, она накопила денег за счет перепродажи риса, и переехала со своей семьей в столицу Бишкек, где  начала перепродавать обувь на местном рынке. Начав свой бизнес с суммы 35,000 сом (KGS), она смогла стать успешным предпринимателем со своими постоянными клиентами. В 2000 году Жыпаргул,  родив младшего сына, взяла кредит на развитие бизнеса  и стала сама возить обувь из Китая, найдя в качестве партнеров – оптовых покупателей из соседнего Казахстана.  Доходы позволили Жыпаргул купить дом для семьи. К сожалению, бизнес Жыпаргул рухнул в тот день, когда ее партнеры, взяв партию товара под реализацию, скрылись, оставив ее в огромных долгах.  Жыпаргул пришлось продать недвижимость в г.Бишкек и в 2010 году переехать в село Вознесеновка. Супруг Жыпаргул, будучи ее главной опорой в жизни, всегда  помогал и поддерживал жену в трудные моменты жизни в их семье. Он начал бизнес в животноводстве, сделав его семейным бизнесом  и привлек Жыпаргул в его развитие. Благодаря настойчивости и упорству семьи Жыпаргул, на сегодняшний день в их хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и один бычок, ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляет около 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы Жыпаргул с мужем мечтают вложить  в постройку хорошего дома и дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Jipargul was born in southern Kyrgyzstan, in a simple farmer's family, and from an early age she started helping her parents on the farm. Jipargul got married at the age of 19, and gave birth to two daughters and a son in 1989, 1990 and 1993.  In 1994, in search of a source of income for her family, she began to resell rice at the market in Osh (southern Kyrgyzstan).  After two years, she had gathered enough money by reselling rice, and she moved with her family to the capital, Bishkek.  There, she worked as a shoe reseller at a local market. Launching her business with an initial amount of 35,000 som (KGS), she became a successful entrepreneur who had regular customers. In 2000, after giving birth to her youngest son, Jipargul took a loan to expand her business and started to import shoes from China, using wholesale buyers from neighboring Kazakhstan as business partners.  With the revenues generated from this business, Jipargul was able to buy a house for her family.  Unfortunately, her business collapsed on the day when her partners disappeared with a shipment of merchandise, leaving her with huge debts.  Jipargul had to sell her property in Bishkek and in 2010 she moved to the village of Voznesenovka.  Her husband, being her main support in life, always helped and supported his wife during the family's difficult times.  He started to work in animal husbandry, turning his activity into a family business and encouraged Jipargul to join him.  Thanks to the perseverance and tenacity of Jipargul's family, their farming business now comprises two dairy cows and a bull and brings about 10,000 som (KGS) per month through the sale of dairy and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Jipargul has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of
100,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy additional livestock. Jipargul and her husband now have one dream: to use future revenues to build a good house and to further increase their number of farm animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive en casa propia; ella se dedica a las venta varias, vasos, ganchos de ropa, cortinas, entre otros, comercia de forma ambulante cerca del mercado de la localidad donde reside, tiene varios años de trabajar en el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a precios bajos, y con un buen servicio; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor ama lo que hace, visionaria aprovecha cada oportunidad que se le presenta pues sabe que así y con constancia y motivación alcanzara el éxito; en las últimas semanas aumentaron sus ventas y la demanda se hizo más grande, no quiere decepcionar a los clientes entonces decidió invertir en insumos por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ganchos, cortinas, vasos, etc. María Magdalena es muy responsable y con buenas referencias de crédito asegura pagará la deuda en tiempo y a la vez confía que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.

loans.use: ganchos, cortinas, vasos

loans.name: Djidide-Dehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDIDE-DEHOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Célestine Perpétue, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Robert. Le couple a un enfant, qui n’est pas scolarisé mais est à leur charge. Célestine Perpétue vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le Célestine Perpétue et son mari. Célestine Perpétue a fréquenté l'école et s'est arrêté au niveau primaire. Pour y arriver, Célestine Perpétue vend de la bouillie de maïs et des gâteaux (faits à base de farine de blé) dans une région du Bénin. Célestine Perpétue s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestine Perpétue ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJIDIDE-DEHOU, sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et de la farine de blé.

loans.name: Mahudagba Group

texts.fr: MAHUDAGBA est un groupe  est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Jacqueline, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jacqueline est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Méda. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jacqueline vend du charbon de bois et des vivres à son domicile depuis dix ans environ. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Jacqueline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDAGBA un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.                                                                                                                                                                                     Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois et des vivres.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is 22 years old. She is not married and she does not have a child. Neema is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students life skills in her nearby secondary school. Neema has a pharmacy business. She requested a Kiva loan to expand her business by adding varieties of medicine in her shop. The profit obtained from the loan will help her include a money-transaction business in her shop using M-PESA and Tigo Pesa in order to get enough profit.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding varieties of medicine in her shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

loans.use: La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

loans.name: Iris Emilse

texts.en:
My name is Emilse and I run a small business which sells business clothes, footwear and cosmeticos. I usually sell them on foot by travelling around the community.

I've been doing this for three years and it is going well. It supports my family and my children who only have a single parent to support them. Right now, Christmas is approaching and I need to access a loan so that I can prepare for the business that is certain to come.

loans.use: Compra de ropa, calzado, cosmeticos y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Whaida

texts.en: Whaida is 34 years old and lives in a household of five in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and is a tailor. To better support her family, she wants to take a loan to buy new machines and all the materials for machines to make a good business. She is a good tailor because she has 10 years of experience working as a tailor. She wants to make a good life for her children. She wants to place them in good schools and give her husband work .

loans.use: To buy extra machines for tailor business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Wamaitha is 29 years old. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 6. Mary has a hair salon business. She started braiding her sisters' hair when she was young and believes that she was born with this talent.  
In 2005, Mary started her business by braiding her customers' hair in their own homes, while others would come over to her house for the service. With time, her customer base grew, and Mary needed to settle in one place from where she would provide the service to the customers. 
When she started out, she only had one small mirror and one chair, both of which she bought with proceeds from her hair-braiding work. These cost her Ksh. 650 (US$10). In December 2006, Mary joined a small co-operative that was giving small loans to the youth in her area. She was able to obtain a loan of Ksh. 6,500 (US$100) which she used to buy four plastic chairs, one large mirror, some towels, and an assortment of combs. She has managed to repay the loan. However, the co-operative is unable to give Mary more funds -the maximum amount she could access was Ksh. 10,000 (US$155). Mary still needs financial help, since, with the equipment that she has, she is not able to wash and straighten hair. She wishes to provide a complete service to her customers, also in order to help them save the time that they use by going to another salon that is far away. 
Mary is asking for a loan Of US$550 which will be repayable within a period of 12 – 18 months. With this loan Mary will be able to acquire some equipment for her salon, including a hair drier, a steamer, a blow drier, and hair chemicals.

loans.use: Purchase of a hair drier, hair steamer, blow drier and hair chemicals

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en: Sudaba is 40 years old, and has been in this business for one year. She is a mother of 2 children, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. This young mother  would now like to apply for a loan of $825 to buy goods for her general store and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
My name is Parveen Mushtaq and I live in Lahore, a city of 10 million people. I am married and have five children. All of my children are enrolled in a small private school. I make jewelry tassels whereas my husband runs a dairy shop. He purchases milk on credit from the farmers in various nearby cities for his milk store, which is rather expensive.

If he were able to purchase milk in bulk, paying cash rather than on credit, it would decrease his operating cost and thereby increase profits. It is becoming hard day by day to feed and educate our children due to soaring inflation. I request a loan of US$ 400 for my husband to purchase milk on a cash basis.

loans.use: BUY MILK FOR RESALE IN BULK AND PAY CASH

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en: Mrs. Oeung S., age 47, runs a stand at a market selling fresh vegetables and grocery products, earning around $2.50 each day. Her husband is a carpenter, making around $6.25 day in revenue. They have six children, some who are married and some who are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase yams from the grower directly and sell them in the market for a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase yams to resell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente G., aged 55, has been married to Nimia González, aged 58, for more than 32 years. They live in their own house in a suburb that is around 5km from the town centre. They have three children, all adults who live in different houses.

Vicente has been a security guard for a private company for the last fifteen years in the same area where he lives. But because the salary is not very high and household bills require more money, he decided to open a store with some savings he had managed to accumulate.

This was four years ago, and Vicente doesn’t regret his investment. His business sells all types of store-cupboard essential goods and ingredients such as meat, dairy products, bread, fruit, vegetables, eggs etc.

The loan he is asking for will be used to purchase stock, in particular chicken and beef, as in the suburb where they live there is nowhere to purchase these products and for this reason various customers have requested that he also stock this merchandise, particularly as end-of-the-year festivities are now approaching.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Vicente G. de 55 años de edad esta casado ya hace mas de 32 años con la señora Nimia González de 58 años, ellos viven en casa propia en un Barrio que queda a unos 5 Km. del centro de la ciudad. Tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores y viven en casas diferentes.

El señor Vicente es guardia de seguridad ya hace 15 años de una empresa privada que esta en el mismo barrio donde vive. Pero como la remuneración salarial no es muy alta y debido a que los gastos de la casa demandan más dinero, él decidió abrir una despensa con unos ahorros que tenía guardado.

Hace ya 4 años que abrió su despensa, y Don Vicente no se arrepiente de su inversión. En su negocio vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad y consumo como por ejemplo: carnes, lácteos, panificados, frutas, hortalizas, huevo, etc.

El crédito que solicita el cliente lo utilizará para la compra de mercaderías como ser: pollos y carne vacuna, pues en el barrio donde se encuentran no hay de donde adquirir estos productos, por lo que fueron solicitados por varios clientes para que también tenga esas mercaderías, mas aun ahora que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Purchase beef and chicken

loans.name: Kabawo I(B) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Margret is 46 years old and married with four children. The busband heads a nursery school. Margret is a poultry farmer and also does some little cultivation. She wants to use the extra profits to expand her business and improve her standards of living. Mary, B. and R. all have poultry businesses and want to use the loan to purchase more chicks. N. offers catering services and wants to use the loan to buy a fridge and purchase more furniture.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feeds.

loans.name: Elvin Francisco

texts.es:
Vicente López has been in the agriculture business all his life being that he lives in a rural zone such as is the Achuapa municipality in León. He is the father of two small children who along with his wife, a homemaker, make every effort to bring them forth successfully and educate them.

Currently, Vicente’s necessity lies in that there is no electric power in his town, for which reason he acquired a solar panel and must now repay this loan. Because of this circumstance, he turns to Ceprodel to request a loan with the objective of paying this debt, which will allow him to have electricity in his home so that his children can study in the afternoons and in the evening and so they have access to a small television. In this way, it will be possible that he and his family can improve their quality of living.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Vicente López durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura por vivir en una zona rural como lo es el municipio de Achuapa en León. Es padre de familia de dos pequeños hijos que junto con su esposa que es ama de casa se esfuerzan para sacarlos adelante y puedan estudiar.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa Vicente es que en su localidad no existe luz eléctrica por lo que adquirió un panel solar y le urge cancelar esta deuda. Por esta circunstancia acude a Ceprodel para solicitar crédito con el propósito de cancelar la deuda y así aprovechar de la energía eléctrica principalmente para que sus niños estudian por la tarde y en la noche y además para tener acceso a un pequeño televisor. De esta manera se hace posible que el y su familia mejoren su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel that will allow him to have electricity in his home.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul Zuhurovna E. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 44 years old, married with six children. She has secondary education and is a housewife. She has a small farm which she keeps by herself. She has a few calves, which she feeds and sells, but she needs one milk cow. She wants to buy a cow to supply her family with milk and sell the remainder to neighbors. This will give her family fresh milk and milk products and give her additional income, as well as let the neighbors who don't have cows buy milk at an affordable price. This is her dream at this time. Kurbongul needs the loan so she can be able to buy a cow. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Элбегиева Курбонгул Зухуровна проживает в городе Яван .Возраст 44 лет, замужем имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшое хозяйство, которым занимается сама. Имеет несколько бычков, которых она откармливает и перепродает , но ей не хватает дойной коровы. Она хочет купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам. Это ее мечта на сегодняшний день. Для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.es:
Evelyne is dedicated to improving her quality of life, and does not scrimp on any efforts to achieve this, as her responsibility as a mother is her major driving force. She has been working for two years raising animals such as chickens, rabbits, and guinea pigs, but she also raises cows to sell at the fairs in Jauja. She built a small stable in her house in order to do this, and her earnings recompense her long term efforts to care for these animals. She is very enthusiastic about continuing to raise animals, since this will be the thing which will permit her to improve conditions. She ask for a loan to purchase a cow and a shed for her guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Evelyne, esta decidida a mejorar su calidad de vida y no escatima esfuerzos por lograrlo ya que su responsabilidad de madre es su más grande impulso. Hace 2 años decidió criar animales menores como: pollos conejos y cuyes pero también cría vacas para luego venderlas en la ferias de Jauja, implementó en su casa un pequeño establo para poder hacerlo y las ganancias retribuyen su esfuerzo después de todo un período de cuidados es por esa razón que está muy animada a continuar con la crianza de animales ya que esto le permitirá estar en mejores condiciones. Solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de una vaca y galpones para sus cuyes.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a shed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 45-years old and a widow with 3 children. She has been selling rice, sugar and flour in the local market for 10 years. She will use her loan to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes in the products by buying in bulk. Cecilia is a member of the group called “Adom Mmorodo” meaning Abundant Grace. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Olimjon M. is a resident of Yavan city. An agriculturist with a higher education, he has a farm. He would like to take out a loan to stock up on seeds and fertilizers for the next planting season. In addition, he needs to rent tractors and pay tractor operators for the wheat harvest. Olimjohn lives with his family – he is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Махмадраджабов Олимджон житель города Яван. Агроном с высшим образованием. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения для посева. Кроме того нужно оплатить аренду и плату трактористам после сбора урожая пшеницы. Олимджон живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Braudelina

texts.en: Braudelina F., 83, is a widowed mother of six, aged 62, 50, 48, 46, 43, and 41.  She has used her Esperanza Bank of Hope loans to expand the selection of her home-run candy business offerings.  Her main motivation for continued expansion are her sons and daughters: though not dependent on her, Braudelina says that they are poorer than she is, and that she specifically needs to help one son who has heart problems.

loans.use: Homemade candy sales

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
This communal bank meets in the area of Huyrapata, the president is Ms. M. Josefina Antonieta, who is married with five children and dedicated to selling merchandise. Alejandro is a graphic designer, Raul offers a taxi service, Haxel sells CDs, Eva sells stuffed animals and toys, Miriam sells pills, Beatriz sells tojori and api ( blue corn-based hot drinks), M. Teresa has a bakery, Nancy sells food and household appliances, Dionicia sells vegetables, Fidelia sells pills , Pamela also sells stuffed animals, Bertha is a nursing assistant, Sonia sells merchandise, Luz sells pills, Antonia sells drinks, Judith also sells merchandise and Elva sells Avon products.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Este banco comunal se reúne en el zona Huyrapata, la presidenta es la señoR. M. Josefina Antonieta, es casada tiene 5 hijos y se dedica a la venta D. mercadería. Por otR. parte Alejandro es diseñador gráfico, Raul ofrece servicio D. taxi, Haxel venD. CDS, Eva venD. peluches y juguetes, Miriam venD. pastillas, Beatriz venD. tojori y api, M. teresa tiene una panadería, Nancy venD. víveres y electrodomésticos, Dionicia venD. verduras, Fidelia venD. pastillas, Pamela también venD. peluches, Bertha es auxiliar D. enfermería, Sonia venD. mercadería, Luz venD. pastillas Antonia venD. refrescos, Judith también venD. mercadería, Elva venD. productos D. Avon

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Mayte Elena

texts.es:
La señora Mayte decidió ayudar en la economía de su hogar, emprendiendo su propio negocio, tenia varios tipos de negocio en mente pero decidió poner uno que le dejara buenos ingresos y al igual pues darle el mejor servicio a todas las personas de su comunidad: una Papelería, poco a poco le fue surtiendo de todo hasta tener de todo lo que sus clientes le pedían, al igual también los estudiantes le decían que pusiera un cyber café ya que en la escuela les encargan trabajos a computadora y el único cyber que se encuentra en esa colonia esta muy lejos. con las ganancias de la papelería y con el apoyo de su esposo, fue que acondicionando el local y empezaron con el cyber, inicialmente tenían pocas maquinas, ahora con el paso del tiempo ya cuenta con mas maquinas que les da servicio a toda su comunidad y mayormente a los estudiantes.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar y remodelar el local, con tu apoyo ella podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Señora Mayte decided to help with the economics of her home by beginning her own business. She had several types of businesses in mind, but she decided on one that would bring her a good income and also would provide the best service to all members of the community: a paperstore. Little by little she was able to grow it until she had all that her clients asked her for. At the same time, the students told her to put in a cyber café so they could do their schoolwork on the computer. The only other cyber café that can be found in the area is very far away. With the profits from the paperstore and with the help of her husband, they air-conditioned the shop and began the cyber café. At first they only had a few machines, now with the passing of time they have more machines that serve all the community, principally the students. Now she needs a loan of US $575 that she would repay in 6 months in order to enlarge and remodel the shop, and with your help she would be able to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and remodel her business

loans.name: Parveen Ashfaq's Clothing Sales Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of Mr. A. and lives in a small area named Bund Road of City Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 2 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Parveen baji's husband has a clothing-selling business. He has been in this business for the last 8 years. Parveen baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband's business by buying more clothes.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nabeela baji and Mumtaz baji each want a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles, waste papers) for their scrap businesses. Ifat baji wants a loan to repair an auto-ricksahw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Ailas baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, thread) for her bedsheet-making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothing to retail during the Christmas period

loans.name: Edner

texts.en:
This is Edner B. B.. She is 36 years old and married with three children between the ages of 3 and 14 years. Edner is also responsible for supporting two dependents who depend on her because they are attendng school in the area. 

Edner has run a tailoring business since 2003. She is able to make different kinds of clothes with different designs. She work 6 days a week and 16 hours a day. Her business can produce a monthly profit of about $500 USD. 

Edner is requesting a loan of $825 USD to purchase an additional sewing machine and other materials for making clothes. In the future, she plans to open another business.

She thanks for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine and other materials for making clothes

loans.name: Cosset Aminta

texts.es: Cosset,  una joven comerciante que comenzó su propio negocio de pulpería  hace ya cinco  años producto de una liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Tiene 24 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, residente del Barrio. Villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, entre sus planes están el verse realizada como madre, el proveerle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y poder ampliar su casa. Desde que inicio su negocio a contado con la ayuda de su esposo y juntos anhelan ampliarlo y transformarlo en una miscelánea, para llevar a cabo sus metas  con es te préstamo,  le permitirá ampliar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera surtir mas el inventario de la pulpería, gracias a la ayuda que le brindara AFODENIC, será posible el cumplimiento de este sueño.
texts.en:
Cosset is a young businesswoman who started her own grocery business five years ago with monies from a settlement from a previous job.
