She is 24 years old, married without children, and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighbourhood of Managua. She wants to have children and give her family a better standard of living and expand her home. Since she has started her business she has counted on her husband's help and together they yearn to expand the business and turn it into a general store. This loan will let them reach their goal; it will allow them to increase their working capital and thus increase their stock in the grocery. Thanks to AFODENIC's help, this dream can come true.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products, supplies and staple goods to supply the grocery

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokunthea H. lives in Boeung Tranch village in Takeo province, where she works as a tailor. Her husband, Mr. Keav Doeun, is a policeman. Even though they work hard, they cannot earn enough money to support their family. In order to improve their life, Mrs. Sokunthea H. has applied for a loan to buy chickens and a cow for breeding. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school. The other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay, married and with one adult daughter, sells women and men’s shoes at one of the markets in Zaporozhye. His net income is about 3,000 UAH per month. Hard working and quite entrepreneurial, Nikolay started the business 12 years ago and now has three kiosks at the market where he and his wife sell shoes. He believes that selling good quality products brings repeat clients and helps his business to grow.

Nikolay would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase his spring collection of shoes. He needs to buy early enough to be able to offer the best selection possible for his clients.

loans.use: To purchase spring shoes for the business.

loans.name: Daniela  Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Daniela tiene 47 años de edad, con cinco hijos  tres de ellos trabajan y dos están estudiando, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo es maestro de obra de la construcción. Ella tiene una pulpería que comenzó con dinero que su esposo dio, el cual ahorro ya que muchas veces los ingresos son buenos. Con esta solicitud de crédito es su octavo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de productos diarios como pollo, carnes, granos básicos para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad, gracias a Afodenic ha podido desarrollarse en su negocio y en su vida personal lo cual espera poder seguir siendo socia y aumentar su capital.
texts.en:
Daniela is 47 years old and has 5 children, 3 of them are already working and 2 of them are still studying at school. They live in the neighborhood called Villa Venezuela in the city of Managua. Her husband is a supervisor for a construction project. Daniela has a small general store which she started with money from her husband. The business usually has good income. This new loan request will be her eight investment in products such as chicken, meat and cereals and grains to offer her customers a good variety. Thanks to Afodenic, she has been able to develop her business and her personal life. She hopes to continue to be a member of the communal bank and increase her income.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small store and purchase stock including chicken, meat and dairy products

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.en:
Y. Aminjon is 24 years old, married and has two children. Aminjon's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business by offering better service to his customers. His dream is that God will provide him with a long life so that he can get ahead and fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Khujand, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for six years. Currently Aminjon’s car needs some repairs and he wants to borrow $600 for 12 months. He thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.   
       
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which began soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a solid business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Coralis Vanessa

texts.es: Coralis Vanessa B. C. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Coralis tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad a la que se dedica es la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Hace más de 28 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación de este negocio es en su vivienda, ya que no poseía  un trabajo estable y es así como decide hacerse cargo de este medio de supervivencia. Por lo que Coralis es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora por lo que sus propósitos son de  mejorar las ventas ya que últimamente que han disminuido por la situación del país. Es por eso que recurre a Fundación León 2000 para un financiamiento que será destinando para capital de trabajo y así compra de materia prima y comprar productos como leña, maíz para que su negocio pueda salir adelante. El sueño de Coralis es de establecer una pulpería para conseguir mas ingresos y generar mas ingresos para sus hijo y que ellos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Coralis Vanessa B. C. is 30 years old, single, and has two school-age children. Her business is making and selling tortillas. She has engaged in this activity for more than 28 years, and works out of her home. As she does not have other stable employment, she decided to focus on this business as a means of survival. Coralis is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, and she wants to increase her sales, which have decreased due to the current situation in her country. So, she has turned to Fundación León 2000 for a loan for working capital with which she will purchase staple ingredients, wood, and corn. This investment will help her business get ahead.

Coralis's dream is to open a small grocery store to increase her income and to earn enough for her children to be able to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zebra Justine Kyomugisha Group

texts.en: Justine K. is married with eight children and one dependent, all of whom are in school. She has been working in her beauty salon for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase hair chemicals for relaxing, braids for plaiting, weaves for hair-weaving and combs for styling. Her dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima D. is from the village of Danao. She is 25 years old. Saima is married. To make a living, Saima owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Saima is just starting this business.

In 2009, Saima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saima is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in starting up the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Saima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in starting up a business

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence A. is a 33-year-old married mother of three. Her children are aged 2, 3, and 5. She and her husband both work to contribute to their family's well-being.

Providence runs an arts and crafts shop specializing in Rwandan baskets in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. She already has one employee after being in business for just one year.  Providence works hard 12 hours a day to earn herself 333,000 FRW a month. As it is Providence's first loan, her hope is that, with this 500,000 FRW loan, she can further expand her basket business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y soltera, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado y con el pasar de los años a hecho que su calidad de vida vaya progresando poco a poco. Los 8 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, tiene un pequeño puesto en la plaza principal de Nuñoa, el cual es muy concurrido, sobre todo por las personas que llegan de visita a dicho distrito, es por eso que acaba rápidamente con la ropa que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y darles confianza para que compren alguna prenda, pero lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, lo cual la desgasta bastante. Su deseo a futuro es implementar una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar ingresos económicos adicionales. Este es el quinto préstamo de Julia con MFP, se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más ropa y así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Julia, 40, is a very happy single woman. She lives alone in a rented room. With the passage of the years, she has made the quality of her life improve little by little. The eight years that she has been selling clothes have served for her to build herself a decent life. She has a small stand in the principal plaza of Nuñoa. It is very crowded, primarily with people who come to visit the district. That is why she rapidly runs out of the clothes she sells. What she likes most is chatting with her customers and giving them the confidence to buy an article of clothing. But, the most difficult is having to work all day under the cruel sun. That really wears her out. Her hope for the future is to set up a grocery store, which would generate additional income. This is Julia’s fifth loan with MFP. She feels responsible about paying on time, because she does not want to cause problems for her colleagues in her Community Bank. She is well liked in her Community Bank for the happiness she brings to the meetings. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more clothes and increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Abinbola

texts.en: Abinbola sells provisions in her shop. She has been in the business for the past two years. She lives in Lagos State. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She is requesting a loan of N100000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Marijana

texts.en:
Marijana Antunović comes from Brgule, a village in Tuzla’s suburbs. She is 22 and unmarried. Marijana lives with her parents who work at a local company.

Marijana, however, is unemployed. She is requesting a loan of 1000 BAM from WWI (Žene za Žene International) to buy chickens and poultry food. She would like to earn money for herself and become more independent. Her parents are now supporting her and will give her a place to keep the chickens.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
GABRIELA C. S.; casada, tiene una hija de 5 años y se dedica a la venta de salchipapas todas las noches, en la zona de la Calichera de Comas.
Hace ocho años, su madre le traspasó su carrito sanguchero y desde ese momento empezó a trabajar con la meta de hacer crecer su negocio.
Como todo nuevo trabajo al comienzo fue un poco difícil y le tomó mucho esfuerzo sacar adelante su negocio; inició vendiendo menú al medio día a muy pocos clientes; ahora tiene una clientela fija a quienes brinda pensión y por las noches ofrece sus salchipapas, pollos broaster y sanguches siendo satisfactoria la venta; ya no solo con su carrito sanguchero si no que ha implementado un espacio de su casa para habilitar un pequeño restaurante.
Gracias a su trabajo ella puede cubrir los gastos del pago de la pensión del colegio particular de su hija y el pago de una profesora particular; además de otros pequeños gastos.
Su próxima meta a lograr en el lapso de uno a dos años es alquilar el local ubicado al lado de su casa e implementar una juguería.
El préstamo solicitado en ésta oportunidad es para invertir en la compra al por mayor de mercadería.
Ella manifiesta que gracias a EDAPROSPO ha conseguido progresar en su negocio, ya que el tipo de préstamo que le brinda es beneficioso para ella por ser a corto plazo.
texts.en:
GABRIELA C. S. is married and has a five year old daughter. Every night, she sells “salchipapas” (a dish made with fried potatoes and sausages) in the Calichera de Comas district. Eight years ago, her mother handed down her sandwich cart, and since that moment she started work with the goal of growing her business. Like all new work, it was a little difficult at the beginning and it took a lot of effort to build up her business. To start, she sold a midday meal to very few customers, but now she has a fixed customer base to which she sells food and at night she sells her “salchipapas”, fried chicken and sandwiches. She is happy with her sales and now, not only does she have her little sandwich cart, but she has also created space to enable her to have a small restaurant in her home. Thanks to her work, she is able to cover the costs of private school for her daughter, the wages of a private teacher as well as several other expenses. Her goal over the next year or two is to rent a small booth located at the side of her house and start a juice stand. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy merchandise. She would like to express her thanks to EDAPROSPO for having enabled her to grow her business and for providing her with the benefit of a short term loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her food making businesses

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ana Isabel P., tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del ahogar , ellos tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder ampliar su vivienda , doña Ana desde hace un año inicio con su negocio de una pequeña pulpería, vendiendo variedad de productos para atraer clientela este negocio lo inicio con capital propio para ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos y aprender hacer una mujer dependiente, ha tenido el apoyo  de su mamá , los planes hacia su negocio es poder construir un local para su pulpería ya que usa la sala de su vivienda y ha dejado de tener privacidad y comodidad con su familia pero todo con la necesidad de salir  adelante con su negocio. Con el préstamo va a comprar diferentes productos para surtir su negocio como: granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes, productos de limpieza y otros que son los necesarios para el uso de las familias Nicaragüense. Da las gracias Afodenic por el financiamiento ya que lograra invertir en su negocio lo cual traerá mejores ventas y ganancias para hacer las mejoras del local.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Isabel P. is 43 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Juan Ramón Padilla. She helps her husband with the household expenses. They have two children, ages 12 and 8, who are students. The plans for her family include improving their living conditions and expanding their house.

One year ago, Doña Ana started a small grocery store where she offers a variety of products in order to attract customers. She started her business with her own capital. Soon thereafter, she was able to help her husband with the expenses and learned how to become an independent woman. She also has the support of her mother.

In the future, she plans to build a separate location for her grocery store. She currently operates her business out of the living room of her house, so her family no longer has privacy and comfortable conditions. She will use her loan to buy different products to restock her business such as basic grains, dairy products, meat, cleaning products and other necessities used by Nicaraguan families. She thanks AFODENIC for providing this loan so that she can invest in her business and achieve better sales and revenues so that she can improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, dairy products, and other merchandise

loans.name: Allen Mununuzi Group

texts.en:
Allen, a 27-year-old married mother of five children between one and nine years of age, four attending school, resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala in Lugala Kosovo zone. She also takes care of additional family members. Allen owns and shares with eight people a five-room house that has electricity but no piped-in water. The family gets three meals a day.

Allen works seven days a week buying charcoal from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala, incurring transport costs as well as daily market dues of 700/= a day. In business for eight years, she sells to all categories of people. Having recently joined MCDT, she is requesting her first loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Allen aspires to expand her business and start buying her charcoal directly from the villages.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es:
Armanda tiene 50 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña sus padres se han dedicado a la fabricación de panes en un horno artesanal, esas habilidades las heredó ella y ahora vende sus panes en las ferias comerciales de una ciudad aledaña a la suya. Su hija mayor es quien la ayuda a laborar estos panes y actualmente están usando el horno que les presta uno de sus familiares. Armanda quiere mejorar su panadería y tener máquinas especializadas para la elaboración de sus productos. 

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socia activa y puntual en su grupo y desea seguir mejorando su negocio con préstamos posteriores. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de su propio horno artesanal.
texts.en:
Armanda is 50 years old and lives with her two children in her own home. Ever since she was young her parents have been making breads in a traditional wood-fired oven. She inherited those skills and now she sells her bread in the commercial markets in a city adjacent to hers. Her oldest daughter helps her with the production of the bread, and currently they are using an oven that has been lent to them by relatives. Armanda would like to improve her bakery and have specialized machinery for making her products. This is the third time that she is taking a loan with MFP. She is an active member and has been punctual in her group and desires to continue improving her business with subsequent loans. The money that she is now requesting will be used to buy construction materials for the construction of her own traditional wood-fired oven.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of her own traditional wood-fired oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po R., age 41, is single and resides in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she is employed at a tailor shop, earning an income of US $3.30 per day. She is skilled in sewing tradtional Cambodian clothes. She has been involved in this business since 2006. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. R. and her family members want improve their standard of living, so R. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her younger brother and sister to commute to school more easily. By doing this, R. hopes that her family will be able to cut back on public transportation services.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her siblings to commute to school

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
La señora Aura Estela R. tiene su propia pulpería la que se ubica en el departamento de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles como pan, huevos, arroz, galletas, golosinas, entre otros. También vende productos de uso domestico como jabones, shampoo y ase.
Ella está solicitando el crédito porque necesita comprar los productos para la pulpería y es por este motivo que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito para adquirir dichos productos. Es importante destacar que ella ha sido fiel cliente de la institución habiendo pagado sus anteriores créditos satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Estela Rios has her own convenience store in the Chinandega Department where she sells all types of food such as eggs, rice, cookies, candies, and more. She also sells household products such as soaps, and shampoo. She is asking for a loan because she needs to buy products for the store. She is hoping that Ceprodel will offer her the loan for these products. It’s important to emphasize that she has been a loyal client of the institution since she has paid her previous loans satisfactorily. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Eddin Brishbana is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Self Help. She lives and works in the community of Belefania in Gbarnga, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. She is single with six children ages three months to sixteen years old; their educational levels range from kindergarten to sixth grade. Eddin attended school through tenth grade but dropped out for lack of financial support. She dreams of sending her children to a better school.

Eddin sells general goods which she buys at wholesale and sells at retail to residents of her community. She sells quality materials in order to attract more customers. She has been in business for four years and hopes business will improve to the point where she can have her own shop.

Eddin faces problems with buying quality goods because of their scarcity. She needs this loan to purchase additional goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Grande Group

texts.es:
La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento esta conformado por la señora Francisca Sofia, quien tiene como actividad la venta D. chocolates al por mayor ubicado en su domicilio, la señora Teresa, es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa en general y la señora Glorieta, es la secretaria D. actas cuya actividad es el servicio D. cabinas telefónicas.  Estas tres señoras son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por Diez  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas.

Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 20% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio ambulando y no cuenta con domicilio propio son madres D. familia  muy trabajadoras que el negocio es el unico ingreso con el cual mantienen su hogar, son responsables con su credito ya que ahora se encuentran en el segundo credito con nuestra institucion sin ningun problema.
texts.en:
The board of directors of the communal bank is comprised of Francisca Sofia, who sells chocolates wholesale in her home. Teresa, the treasurer, sells clothes. Glorieta, the secretary, has a telephone booth business. These three women are the head of the communal bank comprised of ten people who guarantee each other. Most of them have their own fixed business. The other 20% work with merchandise going door to door. They do not have their own homes. They are very hard-working mothers, and their businesses are their only source of income to support their households. They are responsible with their loan. They are in their second cycle with our institution, and there have been no problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la foto es la esposa Claudia Ortiz Urbano.
Jacinto quiere apoyar a su esposa para invertir mas mercancía en el negocio denominado “Miscelánea Claudia” este ya tiene 4 años ubicado en su casa, donde venden refrescos, botanas, dulces, comida enlatada, agua y más.
Ellos son una familia estable en el que tienen 2 hijos; a los cuales tienen que darles una mejor calidad de vida y un buen patrimonio, es por ello que Jacinto trabaja en la maquiladora para obtener más ingresos y su esposa en la tienda para que este al pendiente del hogar.
texts.en:
The person pictured in the photo is Jacinto´s wife, Claudia Ortiz Urbano. Jacinto wants to help his wife invest in more merchandise for her business, "Miscelánea Claudia", which for the past 4 years has been set up in their house and is where they sell soft drinks, snacks, candy, canned food, water and more. They are from a solid family with 2 children, to whom they have to give a better standard of living and a good patrimony. This is the reason why Jacinto works in an in-bond factory to earn more income and his wife works at the store so she can take care of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for their store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio O. se ha destacado en su actividad de tapizado donde realiza diferentes tipos de tapices para muebles y otros artículos habiendo adquirido vasta experiencia en dicho ramo y habiendo ganado algunos clientes para la actividad.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de tela Vinil en varios colores, compra de tela Damasco en varios colores y compra  de 4 colchones para llevar a cabo el trabajo y así satisfacer a sus clientes en este ramo.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio has become well-known as an upholsterer. He makes different types of covers for furniture and other articles, having acquired vast experience in the field and earned a number of customers in the area. He is requesting a loan to invest directly in buying vinyl and damask cloth in various colors, and to buy 4 couches to work on, as requested by his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH FOR UPHOLSTERY

loans.name: Ricardo Orlando

texts.pt:
Ricardo Orlando M. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de13, 10 e 6 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Inhambane para Boane com seus irmãos em 1992 a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 17 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha das 7h as 17:00 horas todos os dias. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a varias razões. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também já se beneficiaram dos serviços desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (saias, fatinhos de roupa e outra roupa diversa) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 11.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Ricardo Orlando M. was born in Inhambane province in southern Mozambique. He is 38 years old, married, and the father of 3 children who are 13, 10, and 6 years old. All of them attend school. He only finished 5th grade and did not continue because of his parents' lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Inhambane for Boane with his siblings in 1992 in order to search for a better life. He has had his own business for more than 17 years and does not have any employees. He works daily from 7am to 5pm and earns about 5,000 MZN per month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He even saves some in his bank account. He has had other loans through the TCHUMA credit cooperative, but he later decided not to continue with them for various reasons. He found out about Hluvuku through friends who also have benefitted from the services of this institution. This is his 3rd loan, which has a value of 25,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy goods (skirts, suits, and other types of clothes) in order to increase his supply. The previous loans were for 11,000 MZN and 15,000 MZN, both for the same purpose. He promises to duly pay back this loan in order to have access to others. In the future, he would like to request more loans to finish building his house in order to offer better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell used clothing

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa N. is from the city of San Isidro, Tarlac. She is 36 years old. Monalisa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Monalisa runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish and seafood products in the local community. Monalisa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Monalisa joined ASKI this year to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Monalisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Monalisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and seafood products to sell

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es: Joaquín G. de 47 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, ubicado al oriente del país. Vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a vender ropa, y a sus dos hijas de 6 y 14 años de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Joaquín posee una venta de pescados, los cuales comercializa en su propia casa. Él cuenta con el beneficio de contar con muchos clientes, ya que ya tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo cual le permite ser muy conocidos por la mayoría de personas del lugar quienes prefieren comprar en su negocio ya que Joaquín vende los pescados frescos y a muy buenos precios. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pescado sobre todo en esta temporada de Semana Santa en donde la venta de mariscos aumenta. Joaquín es un hombre muy responsable quien se esfuerza mucho por su familia, es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo a Integral con e deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joaquín G. is 47 years old and lives in the department of Usulután, located on the eastern side of the country. He lives with his family: his wife, who sells clothing, and his 2 daughers, ages 6 and 14, who attend school. Joaquín has a store at his house where he sells fish. He has many customers because he has been running this business for 20 years, and is well known by most of his customers. They prefer to buy from him because Joaquín stocks fresh fish at good prices. He is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of fish for the week before Easter (Semana Santa), when seafood sales increase. Joaquín is a very responsible man who works hard for his family. He is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral in hopes of improving his sales and thus greater financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en el 11º ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y esta integrado por 19 señoras, las mismas tienen diversas actividades en común e independientes.

La señora Catalina G. una de las integrante se dedica a la venta de bijouterie (joyas de plata) y solicita el crédito para la compra de aros, gargantilla, anillos para su reventa.
Catalina es ama de casa y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, ella sale a ofrecer sus joyas por las casa de amigas especialmente, quienes adquieren sus productos a crédito y al contado. Ella comenta que la venta de joyas deja un buen ingreso y ayuda para algunos gastos de las casa.
Agradece a la Fundación y a KIVA por la ayuda crediticia que le brinda a las mujeres de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
This group is on it's 11th loan cycle with the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women. It is comprised of 19 women who have diverse activities, some shared and some independent. Ms. Catalina G., one of the members, works selling silver jewelery and requests the loan to purchase earrings, necklaces, and rings for resale. Catalina is a homemaker and in her free time she works selling silver jewelery. She goes out to offer her jewelery in the houses of her friends who acquire her products on credit or for cash. She comments that the sale of jewelery provides a good income and helps pay some of the household expenses. Thanks to the Foundation and to Kiva for the credit assistance provided to the women of limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of earrings, rings, necklaces, bracelets, all silver.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca R. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children – one is a college student and the other is a high school student. Her husband is a soldier and supports their basic daily needs. Francisca runs a business buying and selling all types of products. She also has another business selling beauty products. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month.
Francisca has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP from Kiva partner, PMPC, which will be used as additional capital for her buy-and-sell business. This will be her first loan from PMPC. Francisca is a Paglaum Development Program for Landless People (PDP-LP) member.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Carlos Arauz Mena  es un señor de 36 años de edad la cual vive con sus padres y un hijo y sus padres en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.
	 
Desde muy joven don Carlos se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya muchos años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante.  

Don Carlos desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢629,000 (seiscientos veintinueve  mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante y ofrecerle a sus padres quienes se encuentran ya muy ancianos las mejores condiciones de vida

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Carlos Arauz Mena es un señor de 36 años de edad la cual vive con sus padres y un hijo y sus padres en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y naranja. Desde muy joven don Carlos se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya muchos años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante. Don Carlos desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢629,000 (seiscientos veintinueve mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante y ofrecerle a sus padres quienes se encuentran ya muy ancianos las mejores condiciones de vida Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Novillas

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng P., 54, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She raises pigs and chickens for an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband is a Christian teacher, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase chickens and a water pump. She will use the additional profits to support the children’s education.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and a water pump.

loans.name: God Goodness Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Goodness. She is 51 years old, single and has three children who range from 15 to 22 years old. Kebbeh describes herself as friendly. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 16 years she has been selling rice in the Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice.

Her goal is to improve her business and transform it into a rice store.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with three children who attend school. She has been selling CD's and Video cassettes for the last one and half years. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Fatuma’s other source of income is from her husband salary. With the Kshs 35,000 loan, she wants to buy a supply of CD and a glass CD shelf. She faces the major challenges of theft and seasonality. Her potential customers are the neighboring community and passersby. She hopes to open a big theater someday. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to get a loan and modify her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of CD's and glass a CD shelf.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 51 years old. Flor is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Flor owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flor has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

Flor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flor has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Flor is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Miss Kunthy C., pictured here with her loom, is single and lives with her niece on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Kunthy does not have the capital needed to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, so she is asking for a loan of $200 in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Vuong

texts.en: Vuong T. N. is 50 years old. She has a shop that sell fresh fruit. This kind of business, which she started in 2003, provides a stable income with which she can manage her family life. Regarding her attitude to the credit program, she is a very good client. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,938,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop
